The ensnared Quatryl unleashes a torrent of insults and profanities as you search through the debris on the ground below him.

The equipment appears to have been ruined by a recent experiment gone wrong, and you find nothing of use. You leave the fuming Quatryl to his fate.

The ensnared Quatryl unleashes a torrent of insults and profanities as you search through his pack on the ground below him.

The equipment appears to have been ruined by a recent experiment gone wrong, but you do find an intact potion before leaving the fuming Quatryl to his fate.
Tinkerer: 'I refuse to steal from a fellow Quatryl!'

As you continue along your path, an old woman steps out of the trees and blocks your path. She is dressed in ragged clothing, and has a rusty necklace around her neck.

"Greetings travellers," she says. "I sense you are in need of aid on your quest, and perhaps I can grant you a boon. Tell me, what is it that you need most?"
Answer "Gold"
Answer "Knowledge"
Answer "Power"
Leave

"How predictable you are!" she cackles.

She waves her hands and a small pile of gold appears on the ground beside you. You scoop it up and turn again to face the woman - only to find that she has disappeared. You continue down the path, coins jingling in your pocket.
She smiles a toothless grin, and snaps her fingers and vanishes. You suddenly feel full of energy, all aches and pains gone in an instant. Freshly invigorated, you journey onwards.
"A wise choice indeed!" she replies. She waves her hands and you fall to the floor, blacking out. When you wake up, the woman is nowhere to be seen, but you feel your skills have improved.
Wary of strange old women that suddenly jump out of the treeline at you, you decide not to answer her and hastily leave the area.

Walking through a wooded glade, you notice something buried in the undergrowth. Upon closer inspection, you see that it is the body of an Inox face down on the ground, clearly long dead. Mushrooms have begun sprouting in clusters all over the decomposing body, and it is giving off a foul stench.

Looking for anything of value on the corpse, you see that the majority of the Inox's gear is far too rotten to be of any use. His boots, however, look potentially salvageable.
Take off the boots
Leave the corpse be
Unwilling to risk contamination, you decide to leave the corpse be.
You manage to slip the boots off of the corpse, but they are rotten through and disintegrate in your hands. Unable to bear the stench of the corpse any longer, you hurriedly leave the area.

You manage to slip the boots off of the corpse, but they are rotten through and disintegrate in your hands. Intent on leaving, you toss the sodden boots aside, when you notice a small pouch tied around the corpse's ankle.

With great care, you open the pouch and find a few gold pieces inside! Unable to bear the stench of the corpse any longer, you take the gold and hurriedly leave the area.

As you remove the boots, they begin to fall apart, and large chunks of putrid flesh from the Inox's feet come off with them. A cloud of spores ejects from the mushrooms disturbed by your removal of the boots and engulfs the party.

You are overwhelmed with a feeling of nausea and jump back from the corpse, but it is too late - you are poisoned. You toss the sodden boots aside and continue through the glade, feeling awful.

The path is getting less and less distinct as you traverse through the a thick forested area. After a while you come to the conclusion that you must have taken a wrong turn, and attempt to find your way back to the path.

Whilst searching for the path, you happen upon the remains of an old campfire in a small clearing, surrounded by the skeletal remains of several bodies on the ground. Whatever happened here happened quite some time ago.
Search the bodies
Leave
Sick of being lost and keen to find your way back, you leave the skeletons be and resume your search for the path.

Anything of value these skeletons might have once had has long since rotted and rusted away. Sick of being lost and keen to find your way back, you leave the skeletons and resume your search for the path.

You crouch down beside one of the skeletons to search for anything of value when you hear a creaking sound behind you. You turn just in time to avoid taking a rusty sword to the face courtesy of some Living Bones! The skeletons have risen up from the ground to slay those that would dare disturb their slumber.

You defeat the reanimated remains with several well timed strikes, but not before taking a few hits from their surprise attack.

Unfortunately, their gear is corroded beyond the point of being worth taking, so you resume your search for the path, limping slightly.
The majority of whatever these skeletons might have once had has long since rotted and rusted away, however you do manage to find a withered pouch of coins that has managed to stand the test of time!
The majority of whatever these skeletons might have once had has long since rotted and rusted away, however you do manage to find a small item that has managed to stand the test of time!
You discover an old well at the side of the road. Some folk believe that dropping some coins in will grant good luck.
Toss in some coins
(Lose ¬TheOldWell.GoldAmount¬ gold)
Leave well alone

The coins make a satisfying series of plops as they reach the water at the bottom of the old well. You can't help but feel that you've fallen prey to  foolish superstition. You continue down the road feeling no luckier than before.

As soon as the coins slip through your fingers, you feel as if a great burden has been lifted from your shoulders.

Feeling blessed, you journey on.

Before you even hear the coins reach the bottom, you notice that there is a knapsack on the other side of the well! Whoever left it behind is long gone now, so you help yourself to its contents.

Was it there the whole time? No way to know for sure...
You journey on, content with your coins still jingling in your pocket.
At a crossroads you see an ornate wooden shrine, with a slot for passing travellers to make offerings of gold in the hope of receiving a blessing.
Make a small offering
(Lose ¬TheShrine_Small.GoldAmount¬ gold)
Make a reasonable offering
(Lose ¬TheShrine_Medium.GoldAmount¬ gold)
Make a large offering
(Lose ¬TheShrine_Large.GoldAmount¬ gold)
Smash the shrine and take the gold
Leave

You put a generous amount of coins into the slot, and wait...

Nothing seems to happen at first, but you soon feel the warmth of the sun shining down upon you. Filled with a sense of rejuvenation from the sunlight, you turn to continue down the road - when you suddenly notice a potion atop the shrine that you are certain was not there before.

Taking the potion to be a reward for your generosity, you pick it up and journey onwards, pleased that your offering seems to have been appreciated.
You decide not to make an offering and continue on your way.

You put a fair amount of coins into the slot, and wait...

Nothing seems to happen at first, but you soon feel the warmth of the sun shining down upon you. Filled with a sense of rejuvenation from the sunlight, you continue down the road, pleased that your offering seems to have been appreciated.

You put a meagre amount of coins into the slot, and wait... but nothing happens.

You continue down the road, wondering whether you might have been rewarded had you been more generous.

The shrine is well-made and does not break easily, but it eventually succumbs to your attacks and splits open, spilling coins onto the floor in front of you.

You quickly gather up the coins and continue down the path, noticing a sudden chill in the air that causes you to shudder. You can't help but wonder whether your dishonourable act perhaps did not go unnoticed...

As you make your way along the path, the clouds darken overhead and it begins to rain. Within moments, you find yourself in the midst of a full blown storm, complete with resounding thunderclaps and flashes of lightning.

You notice through the torrential downpour that the lightning appears to be striking the same spot repeatedly.
Investigate
Seek shelter

It's cold and muddy under the bridge, but it at least offers you safety from the storm. You look over to the large tree you nearly considered to use as shelter, just as it is struck by lightning and explodes!

You breathe a great sigh of relief for having chosen the sensible option, and reflect upon your experience as you wait out the storm.

You approach the spot where the lightning seems to be focused, catching a glimpse of a metallic object protruding from the ground in the flash from a lightning strike. It seems that this object is acting as a lightning rod, attracting the strikes with unusual consistency for something so small - it could quite possibly be an artefact with magical properties.
Attempt to take the object
Ignore the item and seek shelter
Eager to get out of the rain, you see a large tree up ahead which you could use for cover - alternatively you could double back on yourself to a bridge over a muddy creek you saw earlier.
Shelter under the tree
Shelter under the bridge

You wait for a window of opportunity between strikes to approach the object - only to be suddenly struck yourself!

Unwilling to risk further injury, you decide to leave the object alone lest you get struck again.

You wait for a window of opportunity between strikes to approach the object, and wrench it from the ground.

As soon as the object leaves the ground, you sense a sudden change in the air pressure around you, and the storm begins to subside. Examining the item closely, it appears to be a ¬TheStorm_Take.Item¬!

Pleased with your find, you journey onwards, as rays of sunlight begin to shine down through the dissipating storm clouds.

You wait for a window of opportunity between strikes to approach the object, and wrench it from the ground - but not before getting struck by lightning yourself!

As soon as the object leaves the ground, you sense a sudden change in the air pressure around you, and the storm begins to subside. Examining the item closely, it appears to be a ¬TheStorm_Take.Item¬!

Somewhat singed but nonetheless pleased with your find, you journey onwards, as rays of sunlight begin to shine down through the dissipating storm clouds.

The branches offer some slight protection from the rain as you wait for the storm to pass - when suddenly, the tree you are under is struck by lightning! The trunk explodes violently, sending splinters and fragments flying in all directions. As if being pelted with bits of burning tree wasn't bad enough, the lightning conducts through the party, leaving you all thoroughly shocked.

In searing pain, you stumble in the direction of the bridge to wait out the storm under, having learned a valuable lesson about not using trees for shelter in a thunderstorm.

The path leads you to a narrow passage between two rocky outcrops. You are about to make your way through when several hooded figures suddenly step out from behind the rocks.

'Halt!'

 The largest of the men steps towards you. 'This here's a toll road,' the man grunts. 'If you wanna pass, you gotta pay.'

You notice several others have also emerged from the rocks behind you - you're surrounded.
Pay the toll
(Lose ¬LoseSmallGold.GoldAmount¬ Gold)
Fight them
Attempt to flee
Brute: 'Inox do not run.'

Without hesitation, you take down the bandit leader before his goons can close in on you. Several hacks and slashes later, all of the bandits lie dead on the ground.

You take the coin purse from the bandit leader's belt and continue through the passage.

You attempt to take down the bandit leader before he can react, but he is faster than you expect for a man of his stature. He catches you with a wide horizontal slash with his dagger, before falling after a blow to the head. Injured but undaunted, you turn to take on the rest of his goons.

Clearly no match for the likes of you, within seconds they all lie dead on the ground. You claim the coin purse from the bandit leader's belt as a prize, and continue through the passage.

You dash back along the path, knocking over a pair of bandits as you make your escape. A few of the bandits attempt to give chase, but you quickly lose them in the dense forest.

After a long detour through the forest, you eventually rejoin the path, well beyond where you encountered the bandits.

You dash back along the path, knocking over a pair of bandits as you make your escape. You nearly reach the treeline unscathed when you are hit in the back by several arrows from the bandit archers.

A few of the bandits attempt to give chase, but despite your wounds you quickly lose them in the dense forest.

After a long detour through the forest, you eventually rejoin the path, well beyond where you encountered the bandits.

You begrudgingly hand over the gold, not wanting any trouble. 'Thank you kindly,' the man says with a grin, stepping aside to let you pass.

You awkwardly make your way past the bandits and through the passage, trying to ignore their sneering and derisive laughter as you leave.

Actions are how player characters and monsters take their turns in Gloomhaven and are comprised of one or more abilities.
Adds additional Attack targets
Advantage: An attacker with Advantage will draw two modifiers and use whichever one is better.

Infuse Element - Air: Infuses the battlefield with the Air element, available to be used after the current character's turn and is available for a single character to use for the rest of the current round and the whole of the next round.

Infuse Element - Any: Infuses the battlefield with the element of your choice, available to be used after the current character's turn and is available for a single character to use for the rest of the current round and the whole of the next round. A Monster with an Any Element infusion on their card chooses a random element to infuse.
Attack: An "Attack X" ability allows a character to Attack an enemy within Range with a base value of X.
Default Attack: Perform an "Attack 2" action instead of using the top action. This action will Discard the card.
Attackers Gain Disadvantage: Any characters that attack this character gain Disadvantage on their attacks.
Augment: An active Augment's effects will be applied whenever the Mindthief uses a melee attacks.
Bless: A Blessed character adds a BLESS (x2) card into their attack modifier deck. When drawn, the attack deals double damage, and the BLESS card is removed from the deck.
Command: An action with the Command keyword has the Beast Tyrant's Bear perform the abilities instead of the Beast Tyrant.
Consume Element - Air
Consume Element - Any Element
Consume Element - Dark
Consume Element - Earth
Consume Element - Fire
Consume Element - Ice
Consume Element - Light
Mind Controlled: This Enemy will treat its Allies as Enemies and Enemies as Allies for this round.
Curse: A Cursed character adds a CURSE (x0) card into their attack modifier deck. When drawn, the attack deals no damage, and the CURSE card is removed from the deck.

Infuse Element - Dark: Infuses the battlefield with the Dark element, available to be used after the current character's turn and is available for a single character to use for the rest of the current round and the whole of the next round.
Disadvantage: An attacker with Disadvantage will draw two modifiers and use whichever one is worse.
Disarm: A Disarmed character cannot perform any attack abilities. The Disarm condition is removed at the end of the affected character's next turn.
The dot indicates that this area effect can be enhanced later on to add another hex to the affected area in this slot.

Infuse Element - Earth: Infuses the battlefield with the Earth element, available to be used after the current character's turn and is available for a single character to use for the rest of the current round and the whole of the next round.
An elite monster has greater stats than their normal counterpart, and all elites of a monster type act before any normals.

Enhancement Dot: Denotes that this ability or area effect can be augmented by an enhancement.

A player character is exhausted when they either drop below one hit point, or if at the beginning of a round, they have fewer than two available cards and have burned enough cards that they cannot rest to recover any from discard. If all player characters are exhausted, the scenario is lost!

Infuse Element - Fire: Infuses the battlefield with the Fire element, available to be used after the current character's turn and is available for a single character to use for the rest of the current round and the whole of the next round.

Flying: Characters with the Flying trait can completely ignore all characters, obstacles, terrain effects and traps on hexes during their movement, including the last hex moved onto. However, the last hex cannot be occupied by a character. Characters that lose flying while occupying an obstacle take damage as if they had sprung a trap and move to the nearest empty hex.
Grey hex indicates the users location, meaning that the pattern is a melee attack area effect and thus can only be rotated about this hex.
Heal: A "Heal X" ability allows a character to restore X hit points to a target within the ability's range.
Indicates the attack's area of effect. Red hexes denote the tiles to be targeted, and a grey hex denotes the location of the attacker in the case of melee attack area effects.

Infuse Element - Ice: Infuses the battlefield with the Ice element, available to be used after the current character's turn and is available for a single character to use for the rest of the current round and the whole of the next round.
Immobilize: An Immobilized character cannot perform any move abilities. The Immobilize condition is removed at the end of the affected character's next turn.
Initiative: Determines when this character will act in the round, using the value from the first card of the pair selected in the case of player characters.

Invisible: An Invisible character cannot be focused on nor targeted by the enemy, but can be damaged by non-targeted damage. Invisibility does not affect interactions with allies. The Invisible condition is removed at the end of the affected character's next turn. Monsters treat invisible characters as if they were obstacles.
Small Inventory Item

Jump: A Move specified as being a Jump allows a character to ignore all characters, obstacles, terrain effects and traps on hexes during their movement. The last hex entered will be treated as if a normal Move.

Infuse Element - Light: Infuses the battlefield with the Light element, available to be used after the current character's turn and is available for a single character to use for the rest of the current round and the whole of the next round.
Loot: A "Loot X" ability allows a character to pick up every gold token and treasure tile within range X and line-of-sight, unaffected by monsters or obstacles.
Burned: Denotes that this card will not go to the discarded pile after usage but rather the burned pile, from which cards cannot be recovered by resting (but can be by certain Recover abilities).
Move: A "Move X" ability allows a character to move up to X hexes on the map.
Default Movement: Perform a "Move 2" action instead of using the bottom action. This action will Discard the card.
Muddle: A Muddled character gains Disadvantage on all of its attacks. The Muddle condition is removed at the end of the affected character's next turn.
This ability can be enhanced later on to become more powerful.
Permanently Burned: Denotes that this card cannot be recovered from the burned pile by any means.
Persistent: Denotes that this effect lasts indefinitely or until conditions specified on the card are met.
Pierce: A "Pierce X" attack effect allows up to X points of a target's Shield bonus to be ignored for the attack.
Poison: Enemies add +1 Attack to all of their attacks against a Poisoned character. A Heal ability will cure Poison but have no other effect.

Pull: A "Pull X" attack effect or ability causes the target to be forced to move closer by up to X hexes. The direction is specified by the controller of the ability/effect, and each hex moved must put the target one hex closer. Targets can be pulled through allies, but not enemies or obstacles.

Push: A "Push X" attack effect or ability causes the target to be forced away up to X hexes. The direction is specified by the controller of the ability/effect, and each hex moved must put the target one hex further away. Targets can be pushed through allies, but not enemies or obstacles.
Range: An ability accompanied by "Range X" means that the target must be within X hexes. Any ability with a specified range can only be performed on a character within line-of-sight.
Recover: Allows a player character to return a specified number of cards from their specified discard or burned pile to their hand.
Red hexes indicate the attack's area of effect - targets on a red hex in the pattern will be hit.
Refresh: Allows a player character to regain an amount or even all of their spent and/or consumed Item cards.
Retaliate: A Retaliating character inflicts X direct damage to any attackers within Range. If a range is not specified, then it only applies to adjacent attackers. Multiple retaliate bonuses stack.
Round: Denotes that this effect lasts until the end of the round.
This ability targets the character themselves
Shield: A Shielded character reduces all incoming attacks by X points of attack. Multiple shield bonuses stack. Shield bonuses only apply to Attack abilities and do not stop other forms of damage.
Song: An active Song's effects will be persistently applied until another Song is played.
Cannot Fly: This character can no longer have Flying.
Strengthen: The Strengthened character gains Advantage on all of their attacks. The Strengthen condition is removed at the end of the affected character's next turn.

Stun: A Stunned character cannot perform any abilities nor use items on its turn. The Stun condition is removed at the end of the affected character's next turn. Characters must still select two cards or rest for the turn, however the actions are not played and the cards are simply discarded. A Long Rest is performed as normal.

Summon: Summons a specified allied character to the board, in an empty hex adjacent to the caster. If there are no available adjacent hexes, the summon ability cannot be used. Summons act just before the caster's turn each round, always autonomously performing a "Move X, Attack Y" action where X and Y are their base move and attack values respectively. It is possible to have multiple summons active at the same time.
Health: The number of hit points the Summon will start with.
Target: An ability accompanied by "Target X" means that the character can choose up to X different targets within range for the ability.
Trap: A trap occupies a tile and is sprung when a character enters the hex with normal movement or forced movement (such as Push/Pull).
Wound: A Wounded character suffers one damage at the start of each of its turns. A Heal ability will cure the Wound.
XP: This is the symbol that represents experience points.
1XP: Grants one experience point to the player character.
2XP: Grants two experience points to the player character.
3XP: Grants three experience points to the player character.
6XP: Grants six experience points to the player character.

XP Tracker: This tracker shows how the XP will be granted over the course of the active ability's duration. Each instance of the ability activating will move along to the next XP slot on the tracker, granting the XP bonus of the slot most recently occupied. You can check the XP tracker for any active abilities by hovering over them next to the character's avatar in the initiative track at the top of the screen.

Surely if the Cultists are this indifferent about their security, they can’t expect anyone is foolish enough to assault their stronghold. How wrong they are!
If that is where the treasure is to be found, then that is where you must head next.
You are well aware that magical research often requires a handy supply of gold, and after asking around, you discover his hideout’s whereabouts.
You are well aware that magical research often requires a handy supply of gold, and after asking around, you discover the whereabouts of his hideout.
He explains that the High Cultist had been transporting their wealth to an abandoned necropolis, a distance from here, where he had been performing strange experiments.
With the Commander slain, you expect to find his hoard of stolen treasures, but are sorely disappointed to discover a number of scrolls with correspondence from a nearby cult leader.
The Commander is Slain!
Let's Go!
Head Out
Complete
Start Adventure

Searching the headquarters, you are again disappointed to find a distinct lack of treasure, but you do happen upon a young cult member hiding under a smashed table. You inform him that it would be in his best interest to explain where the loot can be found.
And so to the Spoils...?

With the rotting corpse of the Bandit Commander smelling even worse than the last time you killed him, you look around this damp and empty Tomb. You realise, somewhat too late, that perhaps the best time to pick profitable adventures isn’t while you are drunk in a pub.

But gold and trinkets aren’t as important as making the world a safer place for the common folk, are they? You may not be rich, but you can call yourselves Heroes, and maybe next time you want a drink, someone else might actually offer to pay for it.
The Commander is Slain! …Again.

While drinking at the Wayward Inn, you overhear snippets of conversation between two town militia. Apparently, a local Bandit Commander has come into possession of a number of heretical texts and has begun researching necromancy.
Welcome Mercenaries!
Obviously you are unprepared to assault his base just yet, so you prepare to leave Wayward and head off to raid some local crypts in search of knowledge and some better equipment.

Early Access Build
The sewers of Sweetwater are overflowing and people are going missing, it's time to get down and dirty in Chapter 4: Rotten to the Core!

Chapter 4 of Guildmaster is here, adding another 18 scenarios, 4 monster types, 13 items, a new boss and another two character classes to unlock! 

This update also brings some highly requested features including the ability to ping in multiplayer by double clicking any hex and a new option to view all characters items and cards at the same time by pressing Alt or the new on screen button.

We have started some huge improvements to modding which we have detailed more in Steam and Discord but as this work is still progress, only language mods will be supported initially. More updates will be coming soon!
From January we will be focusing more on creating the final campaign, but you can expect some additional chapters along the way, with new characters classes to play in Guildmaster Mode!
Now and Next

We are still in the early stages of development, so please be prepared to find some bugs and even the occasional crash as you play. Our apologies in advance for these, but rest assured that we are working hard to improve the game with every update, and the feedback from our Early Access players is a vital part of this process.
If you would like to get more involved with the community, click on the links below to join us on Social Media!
A Work In Progress

Now that Adventure mode has been revamped into the new Guildmaster mode, we will be concentrating on continually adding more playable characters, enemies and rules to this mode until we are ready to deliver the original board game Campaign in 2021.

By adding this content to Guildmaster first, we are able to work with the community to improve the game even further and at the same time, give players new challenging content to play on a regular basis.

We also continue to extend our modding support with Steam Workshop integration now available for custom levels. This means you can take your existing Guild and put them to the test against the best the community has to offer!

Enhancements

This screen allows you to add Enhancements to all of your abilities. Select the Ability, then the Enhancement Slot, and then the Enhancement you wish to add to that slot. Be aware that different Enhancements cost a different base amount, and that cost is modified by the number of Enhancements already on the card and the type of ability it is. When you remove an Enhancement, you recover its original cost.

How to Play

During your next turn, Short Rest with all the benefits of a Long Rest:
- <indent=%15>Choose one Discarded Card to Burn and recover all the other discarded cards.</indent>
- <indent=%15>Heal 2 self.</indent>
- <indent=%15>Refresh all your spent Items.</indent>
Unstoppable Destruction

On this turn only, Short Rest with all the benefits of a Long Rest:
- <indent=%15>Choose one Discarded Card to Burn and recover all the other discarded cards.</indent>
- <indent=%15>Heal 2 self.</indent>
- <indent=%15>Refresh all your spent Items.</indent>
Also, a group of rebellious Inox Warriors have set up a base in the forest and are raiding the local populous. Head to their location and take them down!
With the Inox dead, this area is once again safe from their attacks. Hopefully you picked up one of their large axes before you left?

Each Custom Ruleset can have multiple mods applied, as long as the mods don't edit the same files. Warning messages will be displayed if this happens.

The mods you download from the Steam Workshop are not officially supported, so if you have any issues please contact the mod creator. We also can't promise you won't find spoilers in these mods.

Keyport

Keyport is the main trading hub of the western sea, and has grown wealthy and powerful. Rumours abound of the merchant's guild planning a local coup, and the garrison of Staybright has been bolstered as a precaution.

Try to take damage to your hit points over burning cards - it's easier to regain health than recover burned cards.
Watch out for traps! You can see them glinting occasionally to help you spot them.
You can use Push and Pull abilities to force enemies onto traps.
You can press Tab to highlight objects and characters in the level.
You can press Alt to display all of the current character's cards at once on screen.
Use R to rotate your area effect shapes to line them up with your enemies.
Look for synergies not only between your cards, but also the cards of your other party members.
Move abilities on the top half of a card and Attack abilities on the bottom half of a card are uncommon, but can be especially useful.
You can adjust the difficulty to your liking if you find yourself struggling or craving a challenge.
Consider whether you want to act early or late in a round - letting the enemy move towards you first can be advantageous.
You can press Tab to see the order in which enemies of the same type will act.
Enemies can't move through or target players with the Invisible condition.
To consume elements to augment an ability, simply click the toggles that appear before confirming targets for the ability.
Be prepared for more enemies when you open a door - you may wish to retreat rather than advance in some situations.
Choose your party before travelling - once you are on your way, you can no longer switch out party members.
For those really tough missions, consider seeking a blessing from the Temple beforehand.
Job quests have a chance of spawning a chest - be sure to loot it before finishing the scenario objectives!
Be careful when equipping new Items - they'll be bound to that mercenary. You'll have to pay to re-equip them elsewhere.
You can unlock more enhancement types by completing achievements, and more slots per mercenary by exploring the map.
Travel and Job quests scale as you play through the game. Story and Relic quests tend to be tougher!
Not all scenarios require all enemies to be killed to be completed - be sure to check your objectives.
Allies can be a helpful in scenarios, but are often a little reckless - try to divert attacks from them to keep them alive!
If you are unsure if you will get to act early or late, consider picking a pair of cards that are useful regardless of whether you get to go first or last.
Observe the enemy moves and learn their decks and abilities. Some creatures are consistently fast and others slow, which is knowledge you can use to your advantage.
You can press L to see the Line of Sight display.

This camp has been recently deserted after a number of Inox raids from the nearby Forest. A hastily-purposed field to the south bears witness to this fact, with a large number of wooden crosses sticking out of the ground.

Lowtown

Lowtown houses the descendants of the refugees from the great war. Some have worked out how to make a living, many haven't. Life is cheap here, and some shops are too, but don't expect to find powerful magical artifacts.

Merchant
Merciless Overseer
The Beast Tyrant has come to me with information that Rot is spreading across the land.
He is able to converse with some small communities of wild creatures and he has offered our help.
That was kind of him!
In response, they will help us against the Rot, it starts near Sweetwater.
We’ve received word that the Overseer has returned to Gloomhaven.
He’s dangerous, and he’s got history with the Berserker's clan, so I’m letting her lead the investigation. You need to find him and take him down.
An old friend has contacted the Brute with regards to a caravan guard mission he needs help with, go check it out.
It is time for the Cragheart to start their pilgrimage to the holy Savvas shrines in the area. The Temple of the Winds can be found here.
The Elementalist has been researching Swagger, a Hero from hundreds of years past who had mastered both Melee and Magic combat.
I’ve told them to investigate the ruined village of Mudchute near Bloodford. Maybe they can find out how to bolster their own melee abilities!
The Mindthief has received a hastily-scrawled note from the others in her nest under Demonsgate, warning that humans are threatening her home.
Now the Nightshroud is firmly part of the team, he has indicated to me that he wants to research some of the rarer enemies found around the land.
How does he want to research them?
By killing them and dissecting their corpses.
Oh, ‘that’ kind of research?
Yes. First he’s suggesting heading to The Pyre to collect Spirit ectoplasm.
The Quartermaster has heard from an old colleague in Demonsgate that one of their City Guard equipment stockpiles inside the central vault has been raided.
How much did they take? Some of that equipment is worth a fortune!
Pretty much everything, enough to outfit a small army… The Quartermaster has been tasked by Demonsgate to investigate.
We would head straight there, but the vault’s guards were slaughtered - and it appears the thief stole their vault key, too.
I heard Lowtown holds a spare key for the vault. We can head there.
I woke up this morning and found a letter outside the front door. It's for the Scoundrel, and asks for a rendezvous in the forest. Can I not be the middle man in future please?
The Soothsinger asked my advice on places she could go to get inspiration for a few new songs, and I suggested visiting one of the less bloodthirsty Bandit gangs.
There is a group up near Gibbet Hill who might be able to help out.
We have received a missive for the Spellweaver from the Aesther community, asking for help investigating a disturbance in the magical equilibrium in the Eastern Forest.
I'll mark it on your map.
The Summoner has reported a... “shift among the planes” outside Wayward, and has suggested we investigate.
A shift among the planes? What does that even mean?
‘The first impossible connection of two incompatible planes, which must be studied.’ That’s what she told me when I asked her that.
That sounds bad. We should probably do something about that.
The Sunkeeper has advised me that she wishes to use her newly found abilities to do good in the land.
I’ve identified a Vermling Camp near Wayfarer’s Rest that has recently been attacked which may need our help.
But how will they pay us?.. I don’t understand!
The Tinkerer has been studying the origins of Demonology in an effort to try and help defeat them. He's identified somewhere we should investigate.
You've made a good start on heading South West, and we've got a few more towns contacting us for help, all the way to the coast!
Err, boss, there is an Aesther woman here who wants to see you. She says she might be able to help us...
What you are doing... reconnecting people, driving back the darkness, and preserving the weak, I deem it worthy.
I shall grant you access to my Enhancements. Come visit my tent, and together we shall improve your warriors' prowess. The more towns you unlock, the more powerful you can become.
Well, she was straight to the point!

An Enchantress! Be aware, her services don't come cheap. Now we have unlocked more of the world, prepare for the danger to increase. But don't worry, the rewards will follow suit. I've also unlocked some more Achievements to aim for.
After looking in more detail into the area around LowTown, we have found some strange crystals piled up in the forest.
They emit an incredibly strong aura of Earth Magic, and look to have been the cause of the weird behaviour of the Vermlings, as well as the enhanced magical power in the area.
We are getting reports of similar magical deviations around the town of Fordingbridge to the South.
While exploring Fordingbridge a rather unpleasant individual accosted me in the street, he was dripping with what only I can describe as raw sewage.
I initially waved him away, but he told me he was from the Sweetwater town Council, I laughed, but he was adamant.
Apparently they have a problem they need looking into. I told him we would investigate it to make him go away, i'll mark Sweetwater on your map.
I was.. doing some 'important business' in The Sloshed Squirrel and I heard some worrying news from the patrons.
It seems travellers to Amberhill have been going missing, and the whole town is in lockdown.
Probably worth our while going to check it out and see if we can help or err, make some money?
We've reached the coast! That's the first part of the realm reconnected.
I've also been contacted by some outposts in the Eastern forest. We should start to look there for work too.
I'll add that to the next set of Achievements to attain!
We're a good way through the forest now, and I've had more contacts come in, this time, from the Badlands to the north.
Beware though, I've heard rumours of Drakes and Demons. It's not a place for the faint of heart!
The Badlands is well explored now, and we are starting to receive messages from the Great Forest even further north.
Let's seek out the outposts further North. They are surely to have some impressive equipment to trade!
Our last Objective now is to reach Wildspire in the depth of the forest.
Well done! All the towns to the Barren Coast, the Eastern Forest, The Badlands and up to the Great North Forest have been connected. The first chapter of our Guild's history is complete!
It seems the villages of the realm have banded together to reward us with a nice pile of gold coins!
Great work getting through the basic training missions. Allow me to introduce you to the third member of the Guild; he ain't much of a fighter though...

Hey, not all of us particularly care to be experts at stabbing people!

Oh, err... please excuse me. *Ahem*

Greetings, guildmaster. I'm the humble Merchant of your fledgling Guild. I deal with the important aspects of running a Guild... in other words, money. Which, might I add, is sorely lacking at the moment...

What you can see right now is the World Map. You've probably noticed it looks a bit barren at the moment, and, well... I've got some good news and some bad news for you. The bad news is that the realm has been overrun with all manner of unpleasant monsters - rogue bandits, wandering undead, dark cultists, you name it. The good news is that you're going to help us restore the routes back to the other settlements out there, hidden in the fog.

Before we can do anything about that however, we'll need to get some mercenaries on the Guild roster. Let's start with actually recruiting the poor old Brute, who's got himself into a spot of bother... again.
The Brute sure can soak up damage well, but he’s not the most mobile.
Having ample funds is going to be of utmost importance in getting this Guild off the ground. Do you know anyone good at... erm, gold acquisition?
I know just the woman - she’s also a dab hand at poking holes in those who get in her way. She's in the process of liberating some gold right now, shall we lend her a hand?

The first thing we should do as a Guild is re-establish the trade route with Gibbet Hill to the West. We’ve been having a small problem with bandits in the woodland en route, but with the Brute and Scoundrel to assist, that's nothing that should cause you any trouble.
It’ll give you some much needed experience on the job, and allow me to get some new items in stock once the way is cleared. Go knock some bandit heads together!

It's about time you learned about the fundamentals of magic. I know a Spellweaver who should be able to show you a thing or two, and last I heard from her, she was researching a stone circle in a forest nearby Gibbet Hill. With all these monsters about, we ought to check she's OK.

That's the elemental schools of magic covered. Perhaps we could do with recruiting someone who understands hi-tech contraptions and such? I swear there was a Quatryl Tinkerer messing about with a power core or some other artifact in the tavern not too long ago...

Good call. I heard he was looking for fellow explorers to investigate a tomb nearby, barkeep said he set off yesterday. Sounds to me like the sort who might be interested in joining a Guild such as our own - let's see if we can find him!
We're getting a proper mercenary guild together now! Speaking of paid jobs, I've met someone who has requested our help.

Peace be with you. I am the Priestess here, sworn to the Sanctuary of the Great Oak. I thank you for meeting with me, as we at the Sanctuary are in dire need of assistance. You see, the holy crypt in the catacombs beneath the Sanctuary has been broken into and defiled by deranged cultists, raising hordes of undead to do their nefarious bidding... I beg of thee, please help us be rid of this menace!
All too common an occurrence these days... Anyhow, sounds like an opportunity to try out our two latest recruits together - get to it.

I cannot express just how grateful I am... Truly, thank you. With the threat to the Sanctuary gone, we can finally resume the restoration of the Temple here. It will be some time before we are ready to resume our normal services, but I hope we can be of help in the future. I bid you farewell.

Hang on a second, we did that for free?! I thought we were supposed to be looking for paid jo- Oh, never mind... Join a guild, they said... It'll be fun, they said... "You'll make heaps of gold"... Pfft! *Grumble grumble*

Don't mind him. Thanks to you, the Temple will reopen in due time, and you will be glad to receive their blessings.

Now, the next village we've lost contact with is The Marches. The route is under lockdown after a number of raids from small bands of Vermlings camping nearby.

I want you to head up North and see if you can drive them out.

Oh, and watch out for their hounds. Let these scars across my face be a warning to you - you get up close to those dogs and they'll bite back!
Just one more route to clear, and I should have re-established contact with enough suppliers to reopen my shop for business! I'm sure you can't wait to get your hands on some decent gear.

There's some incentive for you! As your core training nears its end, I hope you are getting used to how the various abilities and effects interact with each other. You'll certainly be needing some advanced techniques on the quests to come!
Anyhow, I’ve tracked down a potential fifth mercenary for our crew, if you can get him on board. This guy has fists of stone, and I mean literally!
Cragheart's on board - that’s five mercenaries recruited! I reckon just one more and we should have a large enough crew to take on some quests further out from Demonsgate.

Y'know, if we can find someone capable of summoning allies to the battlefield, it'll feel like we have even more mercs still! I know some Vermlings are quite proficient at handling beastly brethren of theirs.
Vermlings? We're going to recruit a Vermling?

Don't let the rodent exterior fool you, they aren't all feral scavengers. Some Vermlings develop strong psychic abilities - and rumour has it one such Vermling Mindthief is hunting down demons nearby. Would you say no to a demon hunter joining the Guild just because she looks a bit rattish? I vote we find this Mindthief and see if she fancies joining us for a chance at greater glory... than hunting demons. Okay, perhaps not greater glory just yet, but glory all the same.

Now we’ve got the Guild going, we're starting to get job requests coming in from far and wide. I'm also hearing rumours regarding the locations of powerful artifacts that could be worth investigating.

In fact, you should check this one out first: A few nights ago a falling star was said to have been seen landing in a forest clearing near Gibbet Hill, but when villagers went to investigate, there was no trace of anything having landed there.

A day or so later, they started experiencing minor earthquakes emanating just north of the village, not far from the clearing. Nothing up there except an old, decrepit crypt - and the villagers, being villagers, are too scared to investigate.
Sounds like a magical artifact of some kind to me, you should go check it out!
I recommend you bring along the Cragheart and Mindthief, they should easily be up to the task.

And so, that concludes your training. The world is your oyster - a bandit-ridden, undead-roaming, demon-infested oyster.

We've put together a set of starting equipment with the money you've earned thus far, but any other gear you fancy you'll need to buy.
Choose your team, gear 'em up and you're ready to go. Good luck, guildmaster!
Multiplayer is now enabled.

The panel on the left is used to choose your party's line-up, and to customise their ability cards and items as you unlock more. You now also have free rein over which mercenaries to bring along on each mission, up to a maximum of four. Be aware though, scenario difficulty scales with the number of player characters. Unless you are a Gloomhaven veteran, I would recommend you stick with two characters for the time being to keep the decision making manageable!

When equipping items, note that whoever equips an item first has it bound to them. You can unbind an item for a cost, but try to make sure you give it to the right mercenary the first time if you can.
To aid you in progressing your skills post-training, I have come up with a set of achievements for you to work towards. These can be accessed by the Trainer icon at the bottom of the screen.
Completing these will reward the Guild with more gold, quests, and locations to discover. Sometimes even missions to recover powerful relics!

You can pop by my shop by clicking the Merchant icon at the bottom of the screen. I've got mostly basic items in stock right now, but as you keep exploring and restore the routes to more villages, more and more items will be added to my stock!
Speaking of which, could you journey down to the southwestern coast and open up the old spice routes?
I've had links with two towns there in the past: Bloodford to the West...
...and Wanderer's Rest to the South West.
With the Bandit Commander dead, the temples and the Demonsgate nest are now safe.
Well, it’s good to see the back of him, and that ring you got looks pretty useful.
This Rot is worse than we first thought, it is spreading over the whole land.
The Beast Tyrant now wants us to investigate another outbreak in the Eastern forest near The Hermitage.
I’ve talked in depth with the Beast Tyrant and triangulated the spread of the Rot.
As we had originally surmised, it seems to spread via freshwater that originates from the mountains to the south, near Obsidian Bluff.
But there is also a second tributary in the area of Rockfall further to the East.
We believe that is where the Deep Terrors are primarily breeding and is where we must head next.
I’ve investigated further into the cave, and found an immature specimen which I believe is what ultimately becomes a Deep Terror.
I’ll research further, but I believe I may be able to develop a potion to allow us to confuse the Rot into thinking we are an ally.

I looked for something to sell after you left, but only found one of the bandits’ journals. Apparently the Overseer is heading to Ironwood Camp to start an army. I say we head there next - they might have something I can stock.

Can you believe a place called Ironwood has no Iron or wood to take and sell? I did poke around in the ledgers though, it looks like these wagons were heading to a cave outside Drake Fire Farm. Sounds like we will be heading there too, then.
So, I took a look at what you grabbed. Don’t worry, not even I would try to sell it back to you after what you went through to get it.
Anyway, it turns out you stole the map for the entire cave system… and we’ve found a way to sneak you in through a side entrance...
...But it’s got a pretty hefty lock on it. We’re stuck until we find a way to open it.
I’ll return to my trade camp near the Copper Oasis and see if any others of my clan have heard any rumours. Come visit me when you are ready, and I’ll tell you what I have found out.
The traitor didn’t even lead his troops into battle, no wonder their morale broke. He isn’t much of a commander!
We’ve located both his main mustering ground, but also some ruins nearby where he has troops performing strange rites. It's probably worth raiding the ruins first and seeing what he is up to.
The Shrine of the Roots is found in the forest near Lowtown. If they are being systematically looted, I worry that would be a prime target.
These are some highly organised Looters.... there must be someone in charge of all this planning. We need to find out who and make an example of them.
For now, however, we should check out the last of the three temples: the Shrine of Verglas, near River’s Rise
The three core shrines are now safe. Only the mythical Shrine of the Ashes remains, but no one knows of its location.
Well, if we don’t know of it, nor will the looters!
The Elementalist searches the ruined structures and finds some old scrolls from the mayor’s office. It seems after Swagger’s defence of the village, the settlement ended up in huge debt.
The payments are addressed to a tower located near to modern-day Silverwick, in the mountains to the East. It looks like we should head there next.
The library contains many musty tomes on all forms of magic, although almost all have since been disproved as poorly-researched, and are now only useful as kindling.
There is one book of Swagger’s handwritten notes. It both details the payments from Mudchute, and talks of the ‘power of the gods’ given at an ancient temple, accompanied by a crude map.
Looking at this paperwork, it looks as if the Bandits were in Swagger’s pay all along, and that he bankrupted Mudchute to get enough gold to donate at this temple.
The map looks like the edge of the forest up near the School of the Great Oak. Can’t have changed much in a hundred years.
Right, we know where to head next then!
This temple held a portal to the demonic realm. Swagger must have passed through to gain his powers, and returned to our realm through a different portal.
But he never came back did he? Otherwise he’d have laid waste to the land?
It seems not. Also, we found some strange symbols etched onto the wall next to the portal. They almost look like musical notes?
We did a sweep of the area after you left, and mopped up a few more Cultists. We found this incense burner too, which I reckon will come in pretty useful!
Also, it feels as though the elements are in balance again, now that the High Cultist is dead. Good work.
I doubt that’ll be the last Inox Leader we’ll ever see, but the Brute is finally avenged.
I hope any other ones carry more of these awesome axes!
The Summoner tells me that according to Jekserah’s notes, the book we recovered contains a powerful spell written just for the sanctuary we cleared.
Jekserah knew the Summoner would be interested in it. It seems she had us do her dirty work for her...
When cast in the sanctuary, the spell would be amplified until it could raise and control all of Gloomhaven’s dead. It’s fascinating magic - which I will guard.
Jekserah’s ring, however, isn’t guarded by the Enchantress - and seems to harbour potent magic. I would keep it... but it stinks of Undead. Think of it as a reward?
So, I spoke to Vermlings after you left. They owe us for what we did, after all.
They don’t have much to give, being slaves, but one gave me an Ancient Drill as an attempt at thanks... well, they didn’t kill us for our flesh either, I suppose.
Anyway, the drill will do. It’s too old to have any value though, so I can guess you can just have it. A freebie.
With your family scattered into the sewers around Demonsgate, you tell them to head to Lowtown, where you will catch up with them later.
You return the supplies to your makeshift nest. The young are especially pleased to have something substantial to eat.
You realise however, that this location is temporary. You must plan to return to your own nest, and drive those who took it away.
The Nightshroud has taken away the ectoplasm and has started doing some research in the basement of the Guild.
I wondered what that smell was.
He’s now come to me with a mission to recover some Harrower Essence from Hound Hill, I’ll put it on the map.
Most of the Harrowers dissipated after death, but the Nightshroud managed to bottle some insectile remnants.
Do we know ‘why’ he is doing this?
It’s something to do with a Rot affecting the land, next he wants to take down some Lurkers in Crystal Hollow.
The Nightshroud has started his experiment with the creature’s remains, he hopes it will give us an insight into the origin of the Rot.
I hope so too, as then I can move back into the Guild when the terrible smells have gone.
Staying above the tavern is costing me a fortune, and I seem to be spending more time drinking!
I’m not sure how Living Corpses got into a Vermling nest, but at least we can investigate the Demonsgate Vault now.
Why can’t you ever take me anywhere nice?
I’ve also informed Demonsgate of the custodian’s death. I suspect they’ll have words with the Lowtown garrison.
I’ve studied the green substance you retrieved from the Vault. It’s only found at Kailej, inside a cave the locals believe to be hexed.
First an empty ancient vault, now a cursed cave…
You know these are the places we are paid to enter, right?
Doesn’t mean I have to like it.
The forest you discovered fits an old Inox myth of a hidden sanctuary which strengthens all those inside it. It’s a groundbreaking academic discovery.
The artifact is similarly intriguing. It’s a hemisphere, with a strange design engraved on it, alongside a sentence in an old Valrath dialect.
It reads: ‘Your demise opens like necks, but with the start of joy. Come forth, have your body join my employ.’
Neither me or the Quartermaster know a thing about it. We’ll need to solve this before we get pa- er, before we find the stockpile. It likely leads to our thief.
I’ve heard that South Shield has put a bounty on the head of a big ol’ Inox who’s been leading attacks on the village. He might be your guy. I’ll mark it on your map.
You know what, that looks like the forest up near Eaglecrest. I’d bet my favourite hat on it. Probably best to get up there and ask around: they’ll know if any Inox are in the area.
With the Eye dead, we have reports that most areas of Rot are receding, but there could still be pockets of it around the land.
...What happened, what was that smell?
You passed out.
Probably the smartest thing I’ve ever done...
You talk to the remaining Bandits, but none of them have any explanation as to why the camp was attacked by Undead.
Perhaps it was on an old Inox Burial Ground?
The good news is that the Soothsinger got some new bawdy tunes. I suggest we visit some Vermlings to learn some insults next, I know just the place!
What is going on? It seems someone doesn’t want us to learn new songs?
I think it is more serious than that, but it does seem related to the Soothsinger in some way.
In that case, we need to pre-empt the next attack, I’ll talk to some of my Inox friends and prepare a welcome party.
It took me a little while, but we got him to talk, you aren’t going to believe this…
Apparently he is working for some kind of skeletal champion who has a grudge against our Soothsinger.
She is the descendant of a bard who sealed him in a tower to the north of Summerwell
But there is no way into the tower, it has a magical lock on it
That Bandit’s dressed in the gear of the Emerald Knaves, from up near Eastgrove. I’d check out their base of operations next.
After hearing of your predicament, the Keeper of the Oak offers some words of advice.
In our Library at the Temple, there are writings of a shrine where you may ask for a boon in times of crisis. I feel this is one of those times.
I’ll mark the known location on the map, but usually you must prove your worth before it is granted.
Simply say ‘I Require A Boon’ and all will be revealed.
What did she get then?
We do not know, but it will reveal itself when needed.
Well, that's not vague at all is it? Couldn’t it just have given us a big flaming sword or something?
The Summoner wanted more time in there, but she reckons she saw enough to know how to disconnect the realms now.
She used my personal spellbooks to work it out. The Summoner says it cites another spellbook we’ll need - a tome lost to an abandoned library outside Mudview.
Sounds like the perfect business opportunity! I might even tag along.
I’ve just had quite the talk with the Summoner. The book you reclaimed isn’t needed to close the rift. It just ‘sounded interesting’, and she fancied a read.
She almost killed us for a lost spellbook she doesn’t even need? ...We can sell it, right?
On the contrary. She still needs the book, just not for the rift. The Summoner now has a safer way for you all to travel back into that dungeon...
This hemisphere you’ve brought me, neither I nor the Summoner can find how it relates to the interplanar rift.
It has some kind of drawing carved in on the side, alongside an inscription written in a rare, old Valrath tongue.
The inscription roughly reads: ‘It ends a Seraph, without the beginning of pride. And see all who oppose the new queen subside.’ Curious.
Now the Sunkeeper has earned their trust, they say that City Guards came to their camp and wanted to take some of them away.
They resisted and the Guards attacked!
Although they were unable to stop the Guards from kidnapping some of their tribe, they have tracked them to this location near Mudview.
Well, that map points clearly to Mistfell copse.
We should have these slavers taken down by tea-time.
It seems the Sunkeeper grabbed a key from around the neck of a Harrower Corpse.
If we can find the actual base of operations, we’ll have a way in!
These scrolls refer to a temple in the forest far to the north west, past even the School of the Great Oak. It looks as if that is the next area to investigate.
The documentation you have discovered will allow you to perform some rituals of your own. You decide to do this under the Guild itself, in case anything goes wrong!
When your sight returns, the Demon has gone, returned to its own realm. You think this whole experiment was a mistake, when you smell burning…
A map on the wall has a small hole burned through it, a spot just outside the location of ‘The Dome’. You wonder if the Sun Demon was trying to tell you something...
It seems that Melody has tracked Swagger to the same temple we did and then employed a number of priests to create a spell of binding that only a bard could unlock.
We may not have got much else from this quest, but I did find this er… Skull on the floor.
Not even I can sell this, so here you go, it gives me the creeps.
So the City Guard are killing people now? That’s definitely not the kind of protection I pay my taxes for - though I do, er, definitely pay my taxes.
Luckily, Amberhill is known for their enchanted wearables, made with a local magical Amber tree.
They’ve given me a lovely pair of Boots of Speed to help us on our way. Visit my store when you can!
Glad you made it through okay. The trade route is already back in action, and I should have some Stun Powder in stock when you return.
We should get other trade route requests in now, so let’s keep expanding the network. Before you start... go have a bath, for everyone’s sake...
I’ve always imagined the riches I would find inside the Crystal Hollow.. the cave of legends!
It wasn’t great. Most of it was just mushrooms, and not even the magic kind.
But, a fight with a spider led me to fall o- er, discover a half-buried halberd. It seems pretty hefty, and it’s in my store.
I always thought tales of Imps were a load of cobblers, but apparently that’s what Demonspine Hollow is known for. Cobblers that is, not Imps, Come have a look at the new Boots in stock.
The farmers of Drake Fire Farm have taken the spores of some of the strange plants nearby and made some powder bombs.
I’ve not tried them myself, but they seem… unpleasant. I’m sure you’ll love them.
I received a parcel from Eaglecrest today, from one of the Tinkerer shops there. Apparently a group of Inox paid to ship us a Telescopic Sight.
I don’t know if that is a thank you gift, or a withering statement on your martial prowess?
Did you know that Eastgrove used to have a detachment of ancient Royal Guard? I didn’t either, but I now have a set of Platemail in the store for you!
Boneshatter Pass to the South East used to be the home to the greatest shoemakers in the area, but it seems Fordingbridge learned some of their craft as a stopping point on the way.
I’ve got an interesting pair of shoes in stock now.
The blacksmiths of Hammerholm were overjoyed with your work. I have some new armour in stock!
The townspeople are just overjoyed that you drove those disgusting Harrowers out, and gave me a Falcon Figurine.
You’d expect a Hound Figurine, right? Well, apparently falcons are spiritual or something. Anyway, It’s in the store.
I popped into Ironbell after you left to find a weapon of my own. I’m not going to join you on the front line, but I, er, wanted to feel part of the action.
When I told one of the blacksmiths this, she looked at me... and then gave me these Steel Sabatons.
I’ll take the hint. If you could use them, they’re in my store.
The Ironwood Company are overjoyed with your work, and have sent me through the design for a new shield. Come check it out when you get a chance!
I took a trip to Kailej after you left. I figured a warrior tribe must have some pretty valuable weapons.
When I asked the blacksmith for the kind of weapon she thought I’d use, she handed me a pretty ring. That hurt, I’ll admit
I didn’t think it did anything until someone tried to accost me later that night, and I ran away faster than usual… so if you don’t want it, I’ll probably wear it myself.
So, it seems like the city of Keyport is very much in our debt.
I visited the town hall after you left to see how they plan to compensate us… and could you believe they weren’t going to pay us? They just muttered something about ‘eternal gratitude’
Well, I pointed out a rather nice axe on their wall. Apparently it's important to the city’s history, but seeing as we saved the city, it’s now in my store. Take a look when you can.
Lowtown isn’t exactly the height of sophistication, I’m afraid. I couldn’t find anything to add to the shop’s inventory.
I don’t know what you mean, these Hooked Chains would be great in a fight. Use them to drag your enemies within melee range, then Thwack!
They were just holding some crates of potatoes together..
An old man who used to live in Millpond heard about us trying to save his hometown, and gifted us his traditional Millpondian Reaping Scythe which he used to harvest crops with.
Who knows, maybe you’ll find a use for it? It’s in my store.
Boy, am I glad I stayed inside the walls of Amberhill.
Anyway, I managed to barter for the Harrower’s cloak after you left.
It smells weird and there might be an insect or two left, but it seems to have a lot of storage space.
Nasitra is known for it’s beautiful jewellery, so I’ve sourced some magical Moon Earrings you might find helpful.
I had a walk about the camp after you left - thankful people are often the most generous, after all.
One of the survivors offered me a ring as a way of thanks, which I gladly put on...
I tried to punch them in response, without even realising! I’m fairly sure the ring made me do it.
Needless to say, I won’t be seeking out those nomads again. I’d appreciate it if you’d buy the ring before something worse happens.
You should thank me. I travelled all the way to that dungeon and braved its corridors to find something to se- to help you in our quest.
There wasn’t much beside blood and eldritch squiggles, but I did find another ring. I was happy to leave with just that.
But, of course, I walked straight into a room with a stray Black Imp. I wished I hadn’t, and suddenly I was back in the corridor again.
I have a mind to keep the ring, but it’s in my store as a token of my generosity… buy it before I change my mind!
Some villagers scouted out the deeper rooms of the temple after you left, and have got me a few powerful healing potions. They should certainly help.
The Demons attacked from the South. The only destination in that direction is the old tower called Spitepeak.
It seems that is where the Savvas’ base will be found.
The Savvas have given me a charm, which they say may help you in the fight against their brethren.
Ah thank goodness, with the spice route back open, my food can actually start to have some flavour again!
I’ve also been able to get some important ingredients to start supplying Major Stamina Potions. Many warriors value these really highly!
I couldn’t wait to get into Saltmarsh Flats. I mean, a city of magicians? There was bound to be some amazing things in there!
Their shop was full of ancient relics and powerful items… I was just about to take a flaming sword when the owner saw me trying to blow it out so I could hide it.
I grabbed some boots with ‘quick’ on their label instead, put them on, and used them to escape fast.
They’re now in the store, and I suggest you buy them. I’m not going back for anything else.
Advocates from the temple have supplied me with an old helmet that guards from a previous order used to wear.
I’m not sure why a group of healers would need to instill fear in their subjects, then again, I’ve never really understood religion as a rule.
Normally I try to steer clear of criminals, but I decided to see what these bandits had on offer - for you, of course.
They just threw this Volatile Bomb at me. I’m still not quite sure whether it was a gift or a threat.
Either way, it hasn’t exploded… yet. It’s in my store, but I suggest you hurry up.
I’ve done a deal with a local trinket maker to make some interesting Talismans. Come and have a look, you might find them useful?
I received a package by courier this morning and it had a pretty piece of jewellery in it. However, every time I look at it it turns my stomach. Probably means you’ll find a use for it!
I popped into town and met a friendly old fisherwife after you left.
Turns out, the town is in love with fishing, and she is in love with, er, me. I just about escaped with my clothes on... and a Long Spear.
Come have a look at my store if you think you could use it.
You head away from the burned copse, and the journey to Silverwick passes without any more trouble.
Silverwick’s trade route is open once again, and the thankful villagers have given me a smart-looking helmet for you to try out.
I’ve been contacted by a considerable amount of villagers from Rockfall, a Savvas community to the East.
They are concerned that the recent occurrences are due to a group of rogue magic users who left their community for Wayward, and think that we should head there next.
This is it! We’ve got to the southwestern tip of the realm, and I now have access to the armourers that give South Shield its name.
This should ensure peace returns to the land.
Maybe for a whole day if we are lucky!
I popped into the tower after you left and picked up an interesting staff that someone left behind. Perhaps you can find a use for it?
Staybright Fort is very big and old, so I thought I’d nip in to see what treasures its basement hides.
Turns out, the damn thing is full of unstable explosives. Just… why?!
I managed to get some out safely. I don’t know what you’ll do with it, but I’d encourage you to buy it before it explodes.
After resting in the cave and continuing to Summerwell, the weather was a lot milder.
The villagers are overjoyed that the cold snap they had experienced is over. Although, their vineyards are ruined...
One of the villagers sent me an ornate dagger as a thank you. You might find it useful?
Apparently, the Savvas have left for an ancient Savvas Temple in an extinct volcano in the mountains. We should head there next.
Fortunately Sweetwater isn’t all sewer, so I had a poke around once the villagers had scrubbed the town down.
I managed to find a solid helmet in a bush. It stunk worse than a Cultist’s table, but I couldn’t pass it up.
Apparently it had an owner, but she slipped on some stray sewage chasing me, so I guess it's a lucky helmet. It’s in my store when you get a chance.
Thank you for cleansing the temple of those vile Hounds! Our followers will soon return and get the site functional again.
As a token of our thanks, we will supply your merchant with our powerful healing potions.
We are now linked with the coastal traders, which means I have some access to items from across the sea. Something you might be interested in is a cool winged Helm, come have a look!
Ruins from an ancient civilisation, just freed of monsters? Of course I went back after you left, and you better be glad I did.
I spotted a pair of greaves near the reservoir, and pulled them out of some questionable goo.
They are MUCH heavier than they look, but are still in decent condition. Heavy means useful… right? Take a look when you can.
The first item dug up from the city was an amulet with healing properties, it’s now in stock. Have you ever wondered why so many corpses have a healing potion in their pockets...?
Some local Inox tribesman are supplying me with some of their weighted nets, perhaps you might find a use for them in combat… The nets that is, not the tribesmen.
It seems the historians have found a stash of unpleasant ritualistic knives used by the Cultists. I’m sure they’ll come in handy for someone like you...
The Mayor said that one of his dogs had a strange amulet around its neck, and wondered if it might help you work out what happened.
I’ve never seen it’s like before, but it seems to have some magical properties, so you might have a use for it?

He was rather apologetic, and has promised not to dabble in reanimation again, so I convinced him to change his line of research to alchemy instead .The good news is that he’s already started to supply me with a source of more powerful Mana Potions!
The Temple indicates two elemental focal sites in the surrounding areas, where the ancient Savvas set up altars to control the weather.
It is likely you will find the Savvas at these locations, as well as where they are collecting their crystals from.
We should head to these locations and disable the altars. I’ve marked the locations on your map.
One of the archaeologists was so happy for the weather to have changed that she sent me an ancient shield she excavated last year. It looks to be in pretty good condition!
It seems that defiling the undead’s resting place was the cause of the haunting, and now they have been re-laid to rest. Military forces have left a small retinue guarding the keep again.
The good news for us is that I know a Quartermaster who can get us a supply of Chainmail... just don’t tell his commander!
I couldn’t resist the allure of a digsite full of rare and ancient artifacts. There was a lot more there than they told you, you know.
I came across a very striking cloak, but I floated into the air as I put it on. It took me two hours to get down… and now I’m even scared of getting up on a horse!
You’ll never catch me dead in that cloak again, but I’m sure it has its uses. It’s in my store - just be careful putting it on.
The landlord was pretty happy when you arrived. Apparently the guests had run out of money, and had run up an almighty tab!
He’s supplied me with some of his special stuff from the basement. It helps you hit harder, if you can remember what it is you are supposed to be hitting!
After talking to the villagers, it seems some of the children had entered the cave and stolen some magical artifacts the week before. This was a form of revenge.
And so in retaliation, you’ve just gone in and killed all the Imps? Seems a little harsh...
So, err, let’s move on... I’ve now got some new boots in stock!
You inform the mayor of your findings and he is overjoyed, inviting you for a hearty feast in his manor.
For a town as dull as Toadmoor, I’m surprised at the workmanship on the jewellery they’ve sent me. I reckon it’s magic too.
I’ve managed to do a deal with one of the local Merchants to get in a stock of Minor Mana Potions, so hit me up for one when you have some spare gold!
Apparently, Wayward has had problems with localized storms for a few weeks now. They're are glad that you have found out the cause.
It’s not the safest town in the land, but that’s probably why they make pretty good sets of Studded Leather Armor! Come check out my shop for a set.
I’ve asked around, and apparently, a group of Savvas did come into town.
They spent time visiting the Savvas Enclave in Wayward, but were quickly dismissed when they mentioned their plans.
I've been told that they then headed east to Summerwell, with a few extra stragglers in tow.
I hoped that the town would reward us with some powerful weapons, but it seems they make fashionable jewelry for more alternative types.
That said, this earring does seem to have some magical properties.
As the Armoury was badly damaged, the Asylum passed me one of their bigger weapons.
Although why an Asylum needs a massive sword like this, I probably don’t want to know.
The monks of Boneshatter Pass are overjoyed that the path has been cleared and have given me some of their fabulous footwear!
One of the villagers from Mistfell Copse gave me an ancestral blade as a token of thanks. Take a look when you can!
Ah, the joyous sound of gold coins in the pocket! But what to invest it in? Perhaps I should get some Minor Mana Potions back in stock...
The boxes recovered from the Mindthief’s nest contain some of the artifacts looted from the three Savvas shrines, but also from a fourth location.
Look, this sigil here is clearly from the Shrine of Ashes. They have found it!
That crate has markings from a shipping company out of Wildspire. I’d bet my hat the shrine is nearby!
But you don’t appear to be wearing a hat?
My Ma told me to never make a bet I couldn’t afford to lose!
Now the Spellweaver has the ‘boon’, whatever that is, we should plan the assault on the Cult headquarters.
But how do we know where it is?
The Sun Demon could have been trying to communicate. Perhaps where it burnt the map?
To the North of Bloodford, in the swamps? I guess that’s where we go then?
You now have both the location of the Traitor’s base and the means to get into it. Prepare yourself for fight!
Has anyone tried maybe… slotting the two hemi-thingies together? Into a sphere?
Intriguing… They fit together perfectly. The inscription has interlocked:
‘Your demise opens as a neck, but with the start of joy. It ends a Seraph, without the beginning of pride. Come forth, have your body join my employ, And see all who oppose the new queen subside.’
Those drawings… they form a map! It leads to the Sewers of Demonsgate. Whatever that riddle means, I’m sure our thief and Demon conjurer will be there. Let’s go.
Where was that side entrance on the cave plan again?
It opens out into a holding area, near the cave’s main chamber.
Is there any chance that it could be a holding area for newly-kidnapped Vermlings?
Maybe… Do you think the Sunkeeper’s key may be for that door?
It’s worth a try, isn’t it?
The Nightshroud’s research is complete, he’s told me the origin of the rot will be the creature at its centre.
That would be south near Obsidian Bluff then?
He also believes that these creatures partly communicate through excretions, and that it’s nest will only be revealed if we are able to replicate them.
I don’t think I’ve ever heard anything so disgusting…
The Potion I have created from the Deep Terrors may help us here, we should head to Obsidian Bluff.
You know what, this angry skeletal chap sounds a lot like a certain hero that the Elementalist has been researching
Swagger? So he did come back from the demonic realm, but then got trapped in Cursekeep?
Hmm, sounds best if we head that way and investigate?
Right, time to take the battle to Keyport.
We'll send a small force by land while our allies go in via ship from the rear.
There are too many troops to the north, we'll have to get help from elsewhere.
I suggest contacting the Mayor of Mudview, she's always had a wise head on her shoulders.
With both temples out of action, the Savvas should now be vulnerable to an assault... if we could find out where their base is.
Hold on, I’ve just got a missive from Rockfall. They are under attack!
Then the Savvas must be nearby, using their own abilities rather than the crystals.
We've got the troops and the weapons, but how do we get them to Keyport?
A ground attack would be crazy, we need to get them in via sea.
Let's take the port at Shimmering Shallows, the Council won't expect that!

Mindthief

Mindthieves make terrifying opponents through the use of psychic assaults, sharp blades, and swarms of tiny teeth.
The Mindthief has a unique Augment system, allowing her to add effects to all of her melee attacks, and later her ranged also. She additionally can control enemies and summon minions to give access to a lot of different gameplay options. Be wary of her low health, however.

Quartermaster
Skilled Valrath Quartermasters are known for aiding adventuring parties in maximizing the effectiveness of their equipment. After all, what is a warrior without a good sword at his side?
Medium
Item Wielder & Support

- <indent=%15>Many item refreshing abilities</indent>
- <indent=%15>Moderate offensive and defensive capabilities</indent>
- <indent=%15>Jack of all trades</indent>

- <indent=%15>Master of none</indent>
- <indent=%15>Weaker with little equipment</indent>
- <indent=%15>Always packs too much luggage</indent>
Travel to Black Barrow to find Jekserah's documents
