Those Altars were placed here, and hidden purposefully. I have a feeling this won’t be the only time you’ll be doing a job like this.
At the start of each round Light & Dark Elements are set to Strong
As expected, you find Demons in the first room. What you don’t expect is that they are fighting each other! This must be the cause of the tremors.
There are many Demons here. Use their disagreements to help you defeat them all.
Now the Demons have been defeated, the tremors stop. You can now go and claim your reward.
What a strange place, with magical enemies. You’ll have to move quickly to reach the treasure, but be sure to kill enough enemies on the way.
A new item is always welcome!
Passing into a second clearing, you spot Cultists performing a ritual. So this is the source of the outbreak!
All Hounds have Poisonous Attacks
The forest opens out to an area with an unpleasant sight: Hounds, feasting on bloated corpses. No wonder they are diseased.
As you press forwards to kill the dogs, the corpses rise up. Necromancy!
Those dogs are not well, best try and avoid being bitten.
I think you might be stating the obvious there...
It seems the Cultists were using the hounds to spread a disease that turns people into the undead. It’s probably best if you torch everything here.
Flame Demons, Spitting Drakes, Bone Rangers… these creatures could level entire villages! Don’t let anything leave alive!
The air cools as the last Cultist is slain. A heretical weight feels lifted from this place.
Cultists always seem to be doing something needlessly reckless. I doubt this will be the only group summoning monsters that you’ll come across.
It seems the attackers are arguing over the spoils. and you catch them entirely off guard.
Strike fast while they are distracted!

You have been contacted by a logging company, complaining that one of their camps has been raided by an Inox tribe using Vermling mercenaries. The workers have all been killed and the company wants the camp cleared of intruders, and the attackers dealt with. You head to the location of the camp, and hear the excited chatter of vermlings and the gruff responses from nearby Inox. They are not prepared for an attack.
The camp is safe once more, and your work here is done.
All Enemies start Disarmed
All Heroes start Muddled
As you step out, you notice none of the Bandits are moving. They do not react. You are about to investigate further, when the nearest one strains a whisper.
Run, run away. The Imps control us, we can’t….
At that moment an Imp flies out, laughing. The Bandits suddenly react and charge into battle.
Take down the Imps, and surely the Bandits will stop fighting.
As the last Imp dies, the Bandits suddenly stop attacking you.
Thank you, we... we had no control of our actions. This bandit life isn’t for me no more, I’m going back to work in a pub!
The room contains an array of enemies, with no rhyme or reason of how they exist together.
This is the work of magic: these creatures should be at each others' throats, but they all exist to test your skills.
Well, let’s kill them then!

A curious letter has arrived at your headquarters, an invitation to take on the Maze of Mystery. Nothing else is included, just a location of the Maze and an explanation of the rewards. Intrigued, you head towards the location, and are greeted by an elaborate entrance to a crypt, what is inside you don’t know, but you decide to enter.
The last adversary dies. The Maze has been defeated!
We are here. Help me reclaim this sacred place.
You heard the Savvas: Keep them safe, and clear the animals out!
With the animals dead or driven away, the Savvas solemnly hands you a coin purse. After a brief discussion they enter the temple, leaving you to go on your way.
It seems the Savvas are discovering more and more of their history around Gloomhaven. We should expect to hear from more Savvas that require our services.
It appears these Savvas are fighting over which discipline is the most powerful, and are catching villages in the crossfire...
Luckily for us, they seem to be just as eager to fight each other as they are to fight you. Use this to your advantage as you drive them away!
As another Savvas falls, the others begin to retreat in disbelief. The local settlements are safe, for now.

These Savvas’ pursuit of power led them to fight each other without regard for those they deem inferior, and it seems many of them feel this way. I don’t think this will be the last group of warring Savvas you encounter.

You accept the job to clear a crypt of Giant Snakes, which sounds like a routine job. When you meet the landowner who offered the job, he seems a little vague about the actual problem: yes, there are snakes, but he’s cagey about anything else down there. He insists the job is just to clear an old crypt. You reluctantly agree and head to the area. The crypt seems normal enough from the outside, and as you head in, you see discarded snakeskin...
The first room however explains his deception: the crypt is also swarming with undead.
Snakes or Undead, as long as the pay is enough, we’ll kill anything.
These undead are going to spawn all night, so your objective is staying alive!
The Tinkerer seems overjoyed with the data he has collected, and the local villagers will also reward you with some gold. A night well spent!
You follow the spirits down a winding passageway, until it opens out into a room, filled with a swarm of Demons.
It seems that the Spirits will aid you in this quest, but one must survive for them to be able to finally rest.
As the last Demon dies, the spirits dissipate, finally at peace.
The Bandits charge out of the forest. They have brought Hounds and Snakes!
The remaining Bandits have decided their payday isn’t big enough after all, they’d rather stay alive, and so they retreat into the forest.
All Heroes start Poisoned
You enter the crypt and see Cultists hastily trying to raise an army of undead... but apparently the family buried here were of the larger persuasion.
The crypt is safe once more. Perhaps in future, the owners might put a stronger padlock on the door. One can only hope.
You arrive to the sounds of pitched battle. The confrontation has already begun.
There are a lot of troops on both sides, and the fight is taking place on multiple fronts.
You’ll need to both stay out of combat if you can, while continuing through the forest!
The forest floor is littered with bodies, but you emerge triumphant.
All Enemies have Poison & Wound on their Attacks
All Enemies start Poisoned & Wounded
Bloodford is plagued by walking corpses, clear a nearby crypt of this blight
Welcome to your first training mission! You've learned the basics, but now you must help the gravely wounded Brute deal with a Bandit Archer Elite, a stronger enemy with greater stats than normal!

With only a single hit point remaining, any amount of damage getting through will cause the Brute to become exhausted. As such, you will have to avoid any incoming damage by burning cards. (For the sake of training, the attack modifier decks will be all +0s for now, so don't worry about those for now.)
Your objectives to start are: • Take down the Archer with a single Attack • Loot the gold she drops Surely you can handle that!
Whoops. Brute had only one hit point remaining which means you couldn’t afford to take any more damage... Try again, but this time choose to burn one of your available cards to avoid the damage.
Nice work on not dying, but the objective was to kill the Bandit Archer Elite. Perhaps there's an ability card you could use with an Attack that will do enough damage in one go? Have another try.

Bosh! Overwhelming Assault is a powerful card, but such power comes at a cost. Actions like Overwhelming Assault's top half with the flaming card icon in the corner cause the card to be burned once used, meaning you can’t use it again in this scenario. Time to grab that gold!

Good job. With no enemies left and your objectives complete, the scenario normally would have ended already, leaving that chest behind. However, for the sake of training, I'm going to set you another objective: Loot the chest!

Before you rush headlong into that trap, you might want to heal up a bit first. I’d suggest taking a Long Rest which will let you Heal 2 and recover enough discarded cards, allowing you to withstand the 2 damage from the trap and reach the chest.
Ouch! A Short Rest is great when you need some cards immediately, but lacks the healing component of a Long Rest... Be sure to select the right rest next time!
What about Looting the chest? It may sound painful, but you'll have to step on that trap to reach it next time.
Ooh, those Boots of Striding will come in handy next time you need a little extra mobility. Right, onto the next part of your training!
Mercenaries that leave gold behind don't tend to be particularly successful; remember to end the turn on gold when you have the opportunity!
You need to be able to move onto the gold to Loot it after you kill the Archer. Perhaps there's an ability card you could use with an Attack that will do enough damage in one hit? Have another go.
Burn a card to avoid the damage
Select a discarded card to burn
Move onto the trap and take the damage
Move onto the chest and skip any remaining movement
Select a remaining action and skip it to end your turn
Kill the Archer in a single Attack
Loot the Archer's gold
Perform a Long Rest
Loot the chest
So, you've learned about the basic Attack and Move abilities, but this time we're going to use some abilities with additional effects.

A Move action with a Jump effect will help you here. Jump allows you to cross tiles containing obstacles or enemies and even move over traps without triggering them - provided you can reach an empty hex to land on.
Those Boots of Striding you picked up last time can be used to increase a Move ability by 2 hexes. That'll enable you to get up close and personal this turn.
You don't have the damage to take her out in one go, but if you act fast you could apply the Disarm condition to her before she can Attack!
Your objectives for this first round are: • Use a Jump movement to get across the traps unscathed. • Disarm the Archer before she attacks. Good luck!
She’s nimble and long-ranged with that bow. You need to act quickly and get up close and personal - remember to use the Boots!
The key here is to get across that trap, and to do that you’ll need a Move with the Jump effect to avoid the damage.
You did it! Not only did you get a decent hit in with Provoking Roar but thanks to the Disarm condition you applied, the Archer couldn’t attack for the turn.
She’s low on health now, so you should be able to finish her off. Your objectives this turn are: • Kill the Archer. • Jump over the traps and Loot the chest. I want you to achieve both this round!
Remember to ensure the first ability card you choose has a low initiative, as you want act early this round before the Archer.
I thought I told you to Loot that chest! You can achieve both objectives this round if you choose your actions wisely.
Too tired to Jump again? Perhaps you need a quick rest... Y'know, to get your cards back, like before?
A rest, stab and a Jump right onto the chest, nicely done. That potion will surely be of use in the missions to come.
Don't forget, during a Move ability, you can use items like your Boots of Striding to increase your movement range.

Remember that Short Rests allow you to recover discarded cards to immediately use in this very turn. Long Resting however takes up the whole turn, and is used instead of selecting two ability cards, giving the character an initiative of 99. In other words, not gonna help you win this round!
Jump over the traps and disarm the Archer before she attacks
Kill the Archer this round
Jump over the traps and loot the chest
To be a successful guildmaster, you need to pay close attention to enemy actions and try plan your moves around them.

Just one simple objective for you this time:
<line-height=20%> 
</line-height>• Don't get attacked!
<line-height=20%> 
</line-height> 
You’ll have to start over if an enemy manages to land a hit!
You’ll need to escape this room by opening the door in front of the Brute, but remember that enemies in the next room will also get to act this round.

My advice? Act quickly, looking carefully at what actions the enemies are going to take. I've set it up so that you should be able to find a safe place to stand, out of reach from all enemies. Let's see if you can survive!
Looks like the Archer got you. You gotta move fast and stay out of her Range , be sure to check her card once revealed by hovering the mouse over her. Have another go.
Remember that newly revealed enemies still get their go this round in initiative order, once the current turn is over. Now just to find that safe spot...
Excellent, you eluded the enemies in both rooms! Opening a door will always add more enemies to deal with, so make sure you are prepared for that when opening doors in future scenarios.
Just one more round of bandit dodging to complete the mission!
You’ll find it tricky to locate a safe space this time. Perhaps you could try preventing an attack to survive?
You can get out of reach of those pesky Archers from the first room by moving further into the room, but then how to stop the Guard attacking you? Think back to the previous mission!
You avoided the Archer, good job!
However you didn’t avoid the Guard, that's somewhat less good… I wonder if there is a way to stop him attacking?
Excellent stuff. You're well on your way to being a professional!
And how about that Disarm - a pretty powerful condition, eh? That and a nice low initiative of 10 makes Provoking Roar a real nifty card for getting out of nasty scrapes.
One more test, then I think you’ll be ready to start exploring the world and recruiting mercenaries to our Guild!
You got hit! Pay attention to where the enemies are going to move to this turn. You need to avoid all of them!
Don't get attacked for 2 rounds

Let’s talk about attack modifiers. So far in your training, characters have always drawn a +0 attack modifier, meaning their attacks have always dealt the exact damage value specified on the cards. This is not normally the case!

In real scenarios, for each Attack, the character will draw an attack modifier which influences the damage dealt. These can increase the damage by +1, +2, or x2, decrease by -1, -2, or x0, or leave the value unaffected as you've seen with a +0. You can see the contents of a character's modifier deck by hovering over any character - note that unlike player characters, all monsters share a single attack modifier deck!

For this training scenario, these Archers have just two attack modifiers remaining in their decks: x2 and x0. We want them to draw the x0 to deal no damage - and we're going to give them Disadvantage to ensure that!

Ranged Attacks have Disadvantage when their target is on an adjacent hex. This forces the attacker to draw two modifier cards instead of just one, and the worst result is selected. As these Archers only have two modifiers remaining, if they attack with Disadvantage, they will draw both but be forced to choose the x0 over the x2 as the worse result, dealing no damage! You can see when Disadvantage will apply from the flashing purple symbol next to the health bar.

You can only Disadvantage one Archer here, so kill the other with a Ranged Attack. Should be easy, as the Brute’s attack modifier deck is full of +1s for this mission. You can thank me later. Your objectives are: • Stand next to one of the Archers to give her Disadvantage • Kill the other Archer with a Ranged Attack
Ouch! That was quite a powerful Attack! Try again - this time, stand next to one Archer and take out the other.
See how she drew both the x0 and x2 modifiers? Disadvantage forced her to draw two attack modifiers and use the worst one!
You also saw how your attack with Spare Dagger drew a +1, thus dealing 4 damage total to take down the other Archer.
Your final objectives are: • Kill the remaining Archer • Loot the Chest
You need to go early enough to get the first Attack in, and then do 4 damage to her.
You managed 3+1 damage last time - remember you have only +1 modifiers for this training mission.
Your objective was to Loot that chest. We might need what's in there for the next mission, make sure you get it!
Nice! A Heater Shield should help you soak up some damage!
You’ve finished your basic training missions - time to introduce you to the other mercs and get you exploring!
Stand next to one Archer and kill the other
Kill the remaining Archer
Loot the chest this round

Let's begin looking more closely at what each individual character can do. In this scenario, Brute has two Level 1 Living Bones Elites to deal with - which means their stats will be greater than their Level 0 counterparts. Monster stats are combined with a base ability card drawn for the monster class' turn, resulting in the cards you see when the monsters' cards for the round are revealed. So, expect them to move a bit further and attack a bit harder, especially as they are Elites!

Note how they both have an innate Shield 1 effect, indicated by the icon. Each point of Shield prevents one damage from incoming Attacks. However, an amount of Shield can be ignored if targeted with an Attack with Pierce .

I, err... have it on good authority that these Living Bones are going to attack more than once each this turn. You are low on cards, and won’t be able to afford to burn any cards, so surviving here will require some Shielding of your own. By the way, while these enemy Shields are an innate persistent effect, normally active bonuses granting abilities such as Shield are accompanied by a Round or Persistent duration icon.

See how the Living Bones have an ability card that lets them Target same enemy multiple times instead of different targets being required? You'll need to get a Shield up to prevent some of the damage.
Be sure to use your Minor Healing Potion during your turn next time too!
Running away isn’t going to help you succeed here. Get back in there and smash them bones!
You killed the Living Bones, but as you burned a card, you don’t have enough cards left for the second round. Remember to use the potion and a Shield ability.
Yikes, that was quite the onslaught! Nonetheless, your Shield prevented enough damage to keep Brute alive. Phew!
Final objective: Kill the remaining Living Bones - good luck, he’s a tanky one!
A tip for you - perhaps you could use the ol' Push and trap combo? Note that Shield only prevents damage from Attacks, but it doesn't do anything against direct damage such as from traps!
He’s not acting too fast this round, so you should be able to deal with him before he gets a chance to kill you!
Remember to Short Rest to get Warding Strength back to Push ol' Bones here across the traps.
Saved the Brute yet again! I hear he's decided that adventuring alone is not working out for him, so he's agreed to be the first mercenary in your Guild!
Let's get out of this dusty crypt and see who else we can recruit.
Your objectives are: • Kill a Living Bones using an attack with Pierce • Apply some Shield of your own • Use your Minor Healing Potion That should help you survive this round.
Kill a Living Bones using a Pierce <sprite name=Pierce> Attack
Survive the round by applying Shield <sprite name=Shield> and using a Health Potion
Kill the remaining Living Bones this turn
Meet the Scoundrel! She is incredibly nimble and mobile, not to mention able to combo off huge amounts of melee damage when things line up just right. Let's help her out of this sticky situation.
Firstly, you need to: • Kill 3 Archers this round before they attack You'll certainly need something that can hit more than one Target at a time!
The Archer hit you. The Scoundrel has some very low Initiative value ability cards, select one of those to act first.
Not quite, I need you to take out all three archers in the same round! If you combine Throwing Knives and Smoke Bomb in just the right way it is possible to take down all of the Archers.

Ha! Feels good picking off multiple targets in a single turn, doesn’t it? One last objective: • Loot at least 5 piles of gold this round A tip for you - sometimes the top half of a card allows you to Move too!
Loot abilities pick up all of the gold within the radius specified by the value, so you work out where you need to stand and get Looting!
You may need to Move before Looting, and not all Move abilities are on the bottom half of ability cards!
Nice! Let me just take care of that gold for you…
For your assistance in this scenario, the Scoundrel has agreed to join the Guild - that means we've got enough mercenaries now for a proper mission!
Kill 3 Archers before they attack this round
Loot at least 5 tiles this round
Right, this is your first proper fight. Looks like two clearings with a couple of bandits each.

Just remember what I’ve taught you, and don’t enter the second clearing until you are ready. You can change your characters' starting positions this time by clicking the white hexes, so choose a formation that suits you before starting your first turn.

By the way, if you're struggling to make out objects and enemies in the undergrowth, you can press Tab to highlight them. You can also see the turn order of monsters of the same class this way. They will all get the same initiative from the card drawn for their class, but the actual order per monster on that class' turn is determined by their ID numbers. Lower numbers act first!
Meet the Spellweaver, a powerful but fragile magic wielder who can harness the natural elements of the world. Good thing we found her when we did, that's a lot of bandits!

To get her out of this mess, you'll need to harness the power of the elements infused in the battlefield. The elemental infusions display can be seen on the right of the screen, indicating which magical elements available for consuming. In this scenario, the Ice element is already infused, but elements are normally infused for two rounds through using actions with elemental symbols on them, available for consumption after the turn in which they are infused.
This round you must: • Consume the Ice element to augment Freezing Nova's Attack, killing as many bandits as you can. • Survive the round by using a Jump Move to get out of reach.
You need to Jump away to safety from the bandits after hitting them with your Nova!

To power up Freezing Nova you need to consume the Ice element before using it. Make sure you click on the Ice symbol to toggle the consuming of the element before clicking elsewhere on the action to use it.

By consuming the Ice element, Freezing Nova dealt 3 base damage instead of 2! Knocking out three bandits plus applying the Immobilize condition so the bandits couldn’t chase after you is pretty darn powerful, eh?

Ride The Wind also infused the Air element for you to use later if need be. You may have also noticed, with only three unburnt cards remaining, the Spellweaver will be exhausted after the next round is over, as you cannot return burned cards via resting!

Fortunately, the Spellweaver has a very powerful trick up her sleeve. Many of her powerful cards may burn after usage, but the top half of Reviving Ether allows her to return all of her burned cards to her hand! Getting the timing right on this one-time recovery per scenario of all burned cards is key to using Spellweaver well.
It's up to you now: • Kill the remaining Bandit Guards! Reviving Ether will recover all of your burned cards, so you can finish these bandits off at your leisure!

For helping her out of that bind, the Spellweaver has agreed to join our Guild! As you saw, her abilities can be incredibly potent, but she can be a difficult character to work with due to the complexity of her tactics.
Have another go at using her abilities. Remember you consume infused elements to power up abilities, and don’t get caught in Disadvantage by using Ranged Attacks on adjacent targets!
Use a Jump Move to survive the round
Consume Ice to power up Freezing Nova and kill the weaker Bandits
Kill the remaining Bandits
Meet the Tinkerer! He’s a great support character to have on a team, but can also take on multiple enemies in a pinch. Looking at all those skeletons, I'd say this counts as one!
Currently he is Wounded and will take one damage at the start of his turns, so you ought to Heal him as soon as possible with that Minor Health Potion.

Looking at where the enemies in this room are, I’d advise you go as late as possible this round. Sometimes it’s better to go slow and let the enemies come to you, so you aren't at risk of being attacked. Then you can use one of the Tinkerer’s famous area effect attacks to deal some serious damage to multiple enemies at once! You can recognise such abilities by their hex-shaped patterns on the ability card, showing you the shape of the area it will target.
Remember to use your items, you have more than just the ability cards at your disposal!

You didn't manage to hit three enemies. Sometimes it is better to wait for the bad guys to come to you, try picking Ink Bomb first and then Toxic Bolt will let them walk into Range before the Tinkerer’s turn.

You may have noticed that if you use a Heal ability when Wounded , the character not only recovers hit points but loses the Wound condition. Healing can also remove a Poison condition, but in that case you will only remove the condition and regain no hit points.
Boom! <nobr><font="MarcellusAlt SDF"><color=#F5E3B0>Ink Bomb</color></font></nobr> was pretty good, eh?
I’ll leave you to finish off the rest of these bad guys. Did you know you can rotate the shape of an Area Effect by pressing R?
Remember when enemies are nearby to try and go first, Net Shooter should help you to finish them off.
This little guy packs quite the punch, eh? Let's sign him up and look for some paid jobs for the Guild to take on.
Heal to cure Tinkerer's Wound
Hit 3 Living Bones this round
Kill the remaining Living Bones this round
The crypt is bathed in an unholy light, emanating from mysterious portals in the corners of the room. You brace yourselves for battle against whatever evil may come through.

The portals suddenly blink out of existence! Whatever dark magic was reanimating the undead seems to cease, and they collapse to the floor. You have survived the undead onslaught and restored peace to the Sanctuary.
Survive three rounds

Hounds burst from the undergrowth, barking at you menacingly, soon followed by a Vermling Scout. He seems briefly taken aback at having stumbled upon a band of mercenaries, but quickly regains his composure and nocks an arrow, ready to fight.
You have located the sparsely defended Vermling Encampment. Driving the enemies away from here should make the trade route safe once more!

Meet everyone’s favourite walking boulder, the Cragheart. You're badly outnumbered here, and will need to employ some defensive tactics. Let's go over how Retaliate works and see how we can use that to help ol' Craggy out of this mess.

Like Shield, Retaliate is an active bonus, that can either last the Round or be Persistent , usually with a termination condition for the latter. While active, melee attackers will have damage inflicted upon them equal to the Retaliate value after each Attack.

Surrounded by this many Living Bones, a retaliation against any that Attack equates to a incredible amount of damage... assuming you can survive the round, that is! Oh, and one last thing: Note that Earth is infused already - remember to click the consume icon on the card if you wish to use the element to power up an ability!

You know one action is surely for Retaliateing, but you have another action which you can still spend on an Attack. Avalanche is a powerful one, especially if you consume the Earth element to power it up!

You know one action is surely for Retaliateing, but you have another action which you can still spend on an Attack. Avalanche is a powerful one, especially if you consume the Earth element to power it up!

You took a fair bit of damage, but that was a great result! A well-timed Retaliate can be devastatingly powerful. By the way, you can see the active bonus from Opposing Strike is still, well, active - just look at Cragheart's portrait at the top of the screen. The little pips in the active bonus' box show you at a glance how many instances remain, and you can check the effect text and XP yield by hovering over it.

Did you notice how the Living Bones’ Shield didn’t prevent any Retaliate damage? Just like traps, Retaliate damage is not explicitly an Attack, and as such will deal exactly the amount it says it will, unaffected by Shields, modifiers and the like.
Right, finish them bones off and we can get out of here!

Remember you still have two activations left on the Retaliate from Opposing Strike, so you can factor in damage from that. Perhaps there is another way to deal damage directly through their Shields in addition to finish these skeletons off?
Well done! That looked like an unmanageable situation at first but as you saw, if you play your cards right you can navigate even the trickiest situations.
Kill 4 Living Bones this round
Kill the remaining Living Bones

Meet the final member of your starting roster, the Mindthief. What she may lack in physical prowess is made up for in her ability to control the actions of enemies and Summon allies to the battlefield. Summons autonomously act directly before the turn of their summoner, always performing a "Move X, Attack Y" action, where X and Y are their respective base stats.

As the Mindthief was out hunting demons, you are about to face a more serious enemy, the Night Demon. These harrowing creatures have an inherent ability to give Disadvantage to all Attacks targeting them, making them often tricky to deal with. Perhaps you can try taking them down with a non-Attack source of direct damage?
For this round: • Summon an Ally • Kill a Night Demon A top tip for you: Enemies will prioritise your Summon if you are at the same range. Use this to your advantage!
Use Gnawing Horde to summon a rat, it can help you fight the Demons!
Although your Push ability card has beenburned already, perhaps there is another way to force an enemy to Move onto a trap to deal direct damage?

Now, your final objective:
<line-height=20%> 
</line-height>• Kill the remaining Night Demons.
<line-height=20%> 
</line-height>

One of the Mindthief's signature traits is access to cards with Augment abilities, such as Withering Claw. While active, these grant persistent buffs to her melee attacks, but she can normally only have one Augment active at a time. They handily always come with an Attack attached too, in addition to setting up the Augment.
These demons are creeping me out so I’ll leave it up to you from here. Good luck!
Perhaps you can try another trap kill on one Night Demon, then combining Attacks with your Summon against the other?
I guess you too can consider yourself a demon slayer now, huh? Oh, it was demon hunter? Whatever, the point is: Well done!
Kill a Night Demon this round
Summon an Ally this round
Kill the remaining Night Demons
You see a pile of equipment in this room. Perhaps the Drill you are looking for is in there?
All Enemies have Shield +1
The cave seems to be formed of a number of chambers, but before you have a chance to search them, you hear hissing and growling. Apparently the cave has inhabitants!
It seems that these creatures have naturally tough hide. Use your knowledge of Pierce abilities to fight your way through them all!
Now the cave is empty, you have time to look at the Drill in more detail. It certainly looks old, but also powerful.
All Heroes & Summons take 1 Damage at the end of each turn
All Heroes & Summons are permanently Strengthened
How dare you come here and lecture us on who we can or cannot sell our goods to!
You maim and kill the denizens of the forest at will, now you shall feel what it is to be hunted!
The peculiar mix in the tea means you will not only lose health at the end of every round, but that for the duration of the fight you are strengthened too!
By the way, that chest over there, it has the same markings as the traps we keep finding. We can’t leave here without finding what is inside!
As you are still not dead, the remaining Inox fall back disheartened. It seems you have won the day.
Okay, next time I suggest we do a deal with people who make traps, just tell me to shut up.
The magical distortion is coming from whatever is in that chest over there.
At the Start of each round Light & Dark Elements are set to Strong and Fire, Ice, Air & Earth Elements are set to Inert
You climb a number of stairwells to what you assume must be the top floor of the edifice, when the passageways level out.
The light is indeed strange: torchlight feels even brighter and shadows seem even blacker. You step into a room and see why… Demons.
Beware, the light is having strange effects on the Elements here. This is going to be a very tough fight!
A compass? A bloody compass did this?
It seems that the compass controlled the Demons themselves. Perhaps you can use its properties on your enemies.
The maze of passages ends in this room, and you see a chest on the floor, this must be where the armour was kept.
Sadly it seems the blacksmith’s corpse burned away long ago.
The Crypt has seen better days; there's rubble and lava everywhere. Tread carefully...
It seems the blacksmith’s tame Drakes aren’t so tame anymore - and the lava has attracted Flame Demons!
All magic is muted here apart from Fire, be careful!
You grab the Armor and get out of this place before it becomes your tomb!
There’s the exit, almost there!
All Mercenaries start Immobilized
The boots are in that chest over there, grab them and get the hell out of here!
The encampment is deep in the forest, this is going to be a tough escape.
Keep running and don’t stop!
You run out of the forest panting hard, but the boots are yours.
This room is in chaos, a group of badly beaten Bandits are trying unsuccessfully to reach a Chest in the rear of the chamber.
The Lurkers within are not happy with the invaders!
Your best bet is to use the Bandits as a diversion and take those Lurkers out, but remember to grab the chest!
Damn, now someone’s coming out of our tunnel, this job is a disaster!
Stop moaning, we were told to defend this spot, while they recover the chest, so shut up and take them down!
The chest is yours and you hurry from this place, hoping to not bother any more of its denizens.
There are the remains of the Loot they stole, and there are the Artillery pieces!
The front entrance has Flame Demons whereas the side entrance has their Frosty brethren.
We’ll need to split our forces smartly.
WIth the Savvas defeated, you take the Loot back down the mountain.
Over there, the artifact is within it!
I’m detecting a magical emanation from much further inside the sewer.
This room is flooded with Ooze, I’d advise trying to keep it clear while someone goes and retrieves the artifact!
With the shawl under your arm, you leave this disgusting place and head back outside to the slightly fresher air.
Loot the Relic
You barge through the door into the shack, where the terrible smell hits you instantly, bones and pieces of flesh litter the floor
Not a witch then, a den of Harrowers!
Well, there is a chest of items, grab it and clear this hut of enemies!
All Enemies <nobr>Heal <sprite name=Heal> 1 </nobr> at the end of each round
Vermlings? Why would a witch consort with Vermlings?
Enchantress - There is a healing aura here, they are likely attracted by that.
As you leave the hut, you set it on fire, hoping to burn out your memories of this place.
There is the Orb, grab it and take down all the Sun Demons!
At the Start of each round the Light Element is set to Strong
The passageway opens out into a deeper part of the crypt. Stone guardians bar the way, and Sun Demons react to your presence.
Beware, as you are close to the source, Light is permanently Strong here. The Sun Demons will be especially dangerous!
Once all the Sun Demons are dead and you have the Orb in your hands, the Golems should power down - so avoid them if you can. Good luck!
As you kill the Sun Demons and retrieve the orb, the light in the crypt fades and any remaining golems power down.
You have struck a blow against the demonic hordes here today!
And that relic should come in handy against Night Demons!
This area also has Stone Guardians. Avoid them if you can: you only need to kill the Night Demons and retrieve the Relic.
The Orb is there, retrieve it!
At the Start of each round the Dark Element is set to Strong
You’ll need to get inside and claim the artifact. Only then will the Night Demons' power be reduced in the area.
Beware, however, that it has created an almost permanent amount of Dark Energy. Use it to your advantage.
With the Orb in your hands, and the Night Demons killed, the aura of dark power leaves the dungeon.
Well done heroes, this area should now finally be clear of their blight.
This relic should aid our fight against some of the brighter demons!
Lose if Scabwit is exhausted
It looks as if the item they have been using is in that chest over there.
Vermling Scouts have Poison added to their attacks
Look at them, living in a cave with Snakes. This is not how Vermlings should live!
Beware the archers, they also have Poisoned arrows... Attack!
Well fought! These Vermling shall no longer be plaguing my tribe!
It’s clear this room is being used as some kind of storage dump, and you can see a chest sitting on the floor. Time to grab the loot and silence anyone who stands in your way.
Entering the tomb, you are greeted by the angry shouts of bandits.
You ain’t getting this star stone, we found it, so Bugger off!
He turns to one of his accomplices and tells them to guard the back room. Well, now you know where it is being stored, smart guy...
The crystal throbs in your hands, it certainly contains some powerful magic. You stick it in your pack and head out.
That is where the Ring will be kept. Kill the rest of the enemies and grab the Ring before reinforcements arrive!
Cultists have permanent Shield +1
Cultists heal 1 Health at the end of each Round
This is one of the Cult’s headquarters, so expect heavy resistance and powerful magic.
Indeed, I detected that the Cultists have augmented themselves with some form of protective enhancements. They will be difficult to kill.
Regenerating Cultists... that’s something I hope to never see again!
So, this is the grand idea? The Cultists sacrifice the Bandits, and then create clothing out of their remains? That is… disgusting!
And by the look of it, the Archers don’t get a lot of say in the matter!
Look over there, it appears that one of the items of clothing hasn’t been used yet. Let’s grab it.
For research of course.
All Characters gain <nobr>+1 Attack <sprite name=Attack></nobr> to all Ranged Attacks
You’ll need to get inside to see what is going on. Something about this seems pretty fishy... why would Bandits and Cultists work together?
I’ve just noticed, there seems to actually be a magical aura in the area meaning all Ranged attacks ARE more dangerous, what the...?
Great work, the cloak is ours!
Kill them, they must not escape!
He neglected to mention his business partner was a Harrower!
Too late to worry about that, grab the Armour and go out that back door!
Blooming Stone Golems too?!
Just keep moving, almost there!
All Bandits have <nobr>+1 Attack <sprite name=Attack></nobr>
All Bandits have <nobr>+1 Shield <sprite name=Shield></nobr>
You pass through a couple of rooms without incident, but entering the next room, the alarm is raised!
‘Ere, how did you get in? Intruders!
These Bandits seem better outfitted than most, best not try and kill them all, recover the Armour and get out!
You escape with the Armour and your bodies intact.
At the start of each Round set ALL Elements to Strong
It is worse than I thought. Not only is the cave full of Demons, but a powerful enchantment ensures that all Elements are empowered continually.
This is madness! The Demons will use these Elements to their advantage.
My advice, move early and use whichever Elements the Demons will consume where you can.
With all the Demons defeated, you look at the Staff in your hands.
The carving is impressive enough, but you wonder if the effort you went through has been properly rewarded with this prize.
All Summons get <nobr>+2 Attack <sprite name=Attack></nobr>
All Summons get <nobr>+2 Move <sprite name=Move></nobr>
All Heroes get <nobr>-1 Attack <sprite name=Attack></nobr>
There is a strange magical aura in the place which creates lethargy and weakness in all but summoned creatures.
You must use your summons wisely and protect them as they will surely bring you victory!
The crypt is quiet once again and the Staff is now yours!
This looks like the main part of the shrine, and if I’m not mistaken, there is a spare Staff in that chest over there!
Inox Shaman have Muddle & Poison on all Attacks
Try to take down the Shamans as quickly as possible: as expected, they have Muddle and Poison on all attacks!
You’ll need to wipe out the Inox out here, and then head inside.
Great work, this tribe is now a lesson to others that try to become too powerful.
Stone Golems as well? He really wanted to test the limits of his armor!
Looks like it’ll be in that chest though.
All Enemies get <nobr>+2 Move <sprite name=Move></nobr>
As you enter the tower, you see the problem immediately, Frost coats the room.
It seems someone was testing out his armor by summoning demons.
I’m also detecting an aura on these enemies, they are able to move faster than normal
You leave the tower with the Armor slung over your back.
Heroes and Summons take 1 Damage at the end of every turn
The curse on this tomb will drain your health at the end of your turn, so keep your health up. Remember to Loot the treasure!
You kill the last enemy, grab the loot and immediately turn to the exit, dragging your wounded allies with you.
Lose if the Mindthief or Cragheart is exhausted
A rock man and his rat friend? You must be the two who have been hampering my operations.
Well, you are just in time to witness my successful research of necromancy, raised from the ashes of your own temple!
My advice, take him down as quickly as possible. He’ll be able to summon a lot of enemies otherwise!
I also sense that the temple itself heals the undead. Be careful!
All Undead heal 1 Health at the end of each turn
Lug crates here, lug crates there... I thought Bandit life might be a bit more exciting.
You mean you’d rather be in the cave with those things?
You have a point….Wait a minute, who’s there?
You’ve been spotted, time to attack!
The Temple of the Ashes is silent again. You decide that it should stay that way, and seal the entrance as you leave.
The cave leads into a sewer system, this whole network is corrupted.
Giant Vipers get +2 Move
Well, this is a new one to me, allied snakes?
Normally I’d be relieved but not with those horrid things in the room over there!
As the last of the Rot is destroyed you make a sigh of relief, this cave network has been cleansed.
Here are the sewers where the Rot has spread from, it needs clearing.
All Enemies start Disarmed
We’ve surprised them this time, quick, attack while they are disarmed!
Another part of the world is free from Rot, but where else will it have spread?
These Deep Terrors are going to keep coming, we need to get the Bears here as quickly as possible!
Yet bears are notoriously slow moving!
In that case we should really try and give them a push!
With a majority of the Terrors dead, they stop spawning and you are free to explore the cave system.
Lose if the Beast Tyrant is exhausted
I don’t ever recall City Guard having service hounds.
We’re, uh, City Guard! And we says stop in the name of the City!
I have an odd feeling that these may be bandits playing dress-up.
So the Berserker didn’t just go berserk and make us murder a whole bunch of guards? I hope you’re right…
I get she’s called the Berserker, but isn’t killing Guards a little, er, berserk?
We’ll talk about this later. First, we need to get out of here alive.
With the camp empty, you are free to explore.
Inside one tent, you find a number of naked bodies next to a pile of dirty, torn clothes. The kind of clothes bandits would wear.
Looks like you were right - they were just bandits after some better clothes.
It is good to know that we didn’t break any laws today.
I didn’t think that the Overseer is a Harrower…
The Overseer sends his regards!
It looks like we’ve missed him again. Kill these Harrowers, and we can find out where he’s heading!
I don’t think these Vermlings are common in this part of the realm.
I think the Harrowers behind them hissing orders and cracking whips might have something to do with that...
Point taken. Push on through these Harrowers, and we should find the Overseer at the puppet strings.
And be merciful to the Vermlings. They’re being forced to fight.
Near the centre of Ironwood Camp, you find the Vermlings have amassed large piles of metal in wagons, surrounded by ledgers and documents. There is definitely a larger plan at work.
How did the Overseer make friends with Harrowers? Actually, how does anyone do it?
I don’t know, but it seems like he’s involved with the goings on at Keyport. We have to be careful.
See! Speak of the devil…
Keep fighting, you can’t be far from the Overseer!
They just keep coming! How are you going to fight them all?
This is getting too dangerous. You see those doors? Those lead into the quarters of one of the bandit leaders. Get in there, grab anything useful, then get out!
Okay, grab those papers!
Then get out of here! I can’t lose idiots to sell junk- I mean, valued customers!
I’ve never seen so many Vermlings in one place. And with bandits? The smell is worse than the manure stand I used to run.
There’s enough Vermlings here to start an army… where do the Harrowers fit in this?
… Wait, a manure stand?
Shh, don’t mention Harrowers! You’ve jinxed it now.
The cold air steams your breath as you escape the cave, but you don’t stop with Vermlings hot on your heels. By the time you stop running, you can see Millpond in the distance.
I wouldn’t go anywhere near that cave again if I were you.
Get back here, and we’ll see if what you grabbed can give us any advantage when you go back in.
Lose if the Berserker is exhausted
You push through to a clearing in the forest and are surprised to see Inox in charge of the hounds. They wear the markings of a traitor from your tribe. This is no random attack!

Hounds come crashing out of the woods and you step forwards to protect Scabwit, but he is having none of it: ‘I can defend myself just fine, you know!’
You aren’t sure of that, you’d better keep him alive if you want to get paid!
With the hounds and Inox dead, you walk over to a body. You were right: the markings are similar to those of the old chief’s bodyguard, who killed the chief in his sleep and took his axe.
My scouts are reporting Inox Warriors with humans flooding through the forest. They are heading right towards us, so expect heavy resistance.
We’ll make a stand here. If we take down enough of them, they should rout. My tribemates will help.
Faced with the solid resolve, the attackers turn tail and flee back into the forest. It looks like you have won!
In this room Inox Shaman are summoning the Demons. They must be stopped!
Brute is permanently Strengthened
The thought of Inox and Demons working together fills you with rage, and you charge forwards to destroy them all!
You don’t know how many of these Demons have already been summoned, but this should put a stop to any more adding to his army.
In a book in the corner, you find instructions on how to enter the inner lair of the Traitor - as long as his troops are out of the way first!
Lose if the Brute or Scabwit is exhausted
At the start of each round the Air Element is set to Strong
That’s it, crowbar the head off that statue. It’ll fetch a pretty penny in some Lord’s estate.
Some of these look almost lifelike. Look at that one by the door, he- wait, was it there a minute ago…? Oh damn, he’s got friends!
These guys are obviously an organized band dealing in looting and robbery: the entrance of the shrine is filled with stolen goods.
The good news is that we should be able to make a bit of money selling this. But, if I were you, I’d check out that any other shrines in the area are safe!
At the start of each round the Earth Element is set to Strong
The place is crowded with hostiles, far too many for you to handle. If you are smart about it, you may be able to take them all down.
Earth is strong here, use it to your advantage!
Silence holds dominion in the now bloody halls of the Shrine of the Roots. You can feel a gentle breeze singing in the stony cracks of your skin.
At the start of each round the Ice Element is set to Strong

As you head into the central chamber, surrounded by stone monoliths, you realise your sixth sense was correct, bandits leap out tio attack you and it seems they have managed to access this shrine’s ancient defences.
Dammit, they have elite Stone Golems. Stay out of their way and take them down at range!
Ice is powerful here. Use that to slow them down, if you can.
You stare at the crumbling remains of the once-glorious golem, for a moment, before the cold brings you back to your senses.
Lose if the Cragheart is exhausted
The village is overgrown and many of the buildings have collapsed: all the villagers left generations ago.
As you start to explore, long-undisturbed bones rise from the undergrowth. Apparently all the villagers didn’t leave after all.
It seems as if the village is silent once more.
I can see some Pressure Plates on the floor there. Apparently someone didn’t want just anyone getting into the room in the back.
The door opens into a library, which is still in reasonably good condition. This may hold the answers you seek.
I think we may need to deal with those Golems first!
As you enter the tower, a smell of sulphur hits your nostrils. Drake droppings...
The Tower is now free from things trying to kill us, so let’s have a root around.
At the back of this room you notice a number of strange altars of bones.
That is a summoning altar. You must destroy it, or more Demons will spawn!
All Heroes start with 2 Curses in their deck.
The passageway leads downwards for a few minutes, as if you are heading into the centre of the earth itself. The temperature starts to rise, and you feel more and more apprehensive.
There is magic at work here, I can feel dark forces. A strong curse covers this place
The passage levels out, and you enter into more of a necropolis than a temple.
Demons? Why would Swagger visit this place? We must investigate!
WIth the Demons dead, and the altars destroyed, the curse is lifted on this place.
Lose if the Tinkerer or Spellweaver is exhausted
Passing through the doorway, you are met by unwelcome sight: a Cultist is bathed in demonic power. He turns, and laughs…
What do we have here, more foolish adventurers? I have met your kind before: they are dead, and I remain.
You look around the room. You are outnumbered. This is going to end badly… Just then, a familiar voice calls out…
‘Your Boon has been granted!’ A number of Spitting Drakes and a Golem phase in beside you. It seems the odds aren’t so heavily stacked against you after all...
As you walk down stone steps carved from the same black material, you struggle to remember the name... obsidian?
When you enter the first chamber, you realise this is not going to be an easy battle. Cultists and Demons bar your way forwards.
After an intense battle, the High Cultist and his followers are dead.
Lose if the Brute or Scoundrel is exhausted
The door swings open, and he stands in the room holding a giant axe.
I used your chieftain’s own axe to kill him you know. He died in one swing. I expect you to do the same.
At the start of each round the Dark Element is set to Strong
You see a door at the back leading to his private chambers, but first you must fight your way through his personal guard.
With the Inox Traitor dead, you feel a weight lift off of your mind. You pick up his axe and head to the exit.
Lose if the Summoner or Quartermaster is exhausted
Why do we have to keep finding dungeons full of things that want us dead?
You bring the book that time forgot…
Keep going. That voice is getting closer.
That’s… Jekserah. It seems she’s worked out how to control Demons too...
With both, I can rule Gloomhaven with a fist of rot!
This smell is UNBEARABLE! Please kill her before she summons more Undead.
Whatever these Living Bones are doing here, they’re likely courtesy of our thief. Press through.
You cleared the Sanctuary I could not…
I vote we don’t follow the creepy voice, and turn around now please!
Jekserah screams her defeat, and as she falls her Demon and Undead minions fall with her. Her plans have been foiled, for now.
The Quartermaster begins collecting the stolen weapons from bone piles and flesh puddles, while the Summoner delves into the journals in Jekserah’s pockets.
You, uh, see Jekserah’s ring? Do you think you could bring it back for me?
Lose if the Berserker or Sunkeeper is exhausted
Oh, here you are! I can’t wait to kill that pitiful Inox and her friends like I slaughtered the rest of her tribe!
I'd be able to understand him better if he didn't wear that ridiculous mask
Watch out for the Vermlings - the Overseer can use his whip to make them fight even harder, the poor creatures...
All Vermlings have +1 Shield
So, that explains the metal at Ironwood…
The Vermlings look like adorable little knights. Shame you have to fight them.
‘Now you’ve returned, this cave will become your tomb!’
I think that voice is the Overseer.
Would you mind shutting him up? The main chamber is straight ahead.
Even before the Overseer falls dead to the ground, the Berserker is on him with her blades.
You decide it is best to leave her to... make her peace, and help the newly-freed Vermlings release their caged kin.
Well done, you’ve stopped a Vermling army ravaging the land.
Well, it would have been a particularly warm and furry way to die…but yes, congratulations are in order.
Destroy all Ancient Artillery in all rooms
Kill all Forest Imps in all rooms
Your fellow Vermlings have fled through the way you entered, leaving you and the pack’s rat swarm to guard their backs.
To give them time, you must defeat the Bandit leaders, whilst ensuring your swarm isn’t entirely defeated.
You hear the signal that everyone is safe, and so leave your home and head for the surface.
The remaining Bandits don’t give chase, but you catch the scent of smoke down the tunnels. Your home is no more.
Bandits have learned how to train Bears now. Will wonders never cease?
The bandit encampment appears to be light on manpower as you attack... but Hounds? They have a lot of Hounds!
You’ll need to loot 3 chests of supplies to succeed. They’ll likely have a bit of gold in too!
You secured a feast, and the pack will live to fight another day. Time to regroup and take back what is yours.
All Bandit Guards and Archers start Poisoned

You sneak past the incapacitated guards outside, and witness the results of your strategy with satisfaction. The opposition is numerous, but not as fierce at it used to be. Now you have a fighting chance!
Your herbs have sent the animals into a wild frenzy, they are attacking anyone in range. I’d stay back if you can.

You have claimed back your territory, and a great feast is in order! It is clear, however, that none of these goons were in command, which means more will return. You need to put an end to this invasion yourself.
That looks like the exit, don’t leave anyone behind!
This is unfortunate, we are a LONG way underground.
Yes, there are a lot of corridors to pass through until we see daylight again.
But we also must kill enough Living Spirits on the way to ensure the Nightshroud recovers enough research!
You escape out of the crypt with the samples.
They’ve managed to activate some Stone Golems in defence, avoid them if you can.
Hounds this way, they are too fast to outrun!
Enemies start muddled
We’ve certainly got the drop on them, but I can’t see any Harrowers in here.
We’ll need to spread out as I expect the Harrowers will be in different parts of the sewer, and it is a pretty big network.
Don’t take too long though, or they’ll be able to escape!
With all the Harrowers dead, the other enemies flee into side passages.
The Lurkers must be further in the cave system, but these are also home to some very unpleasant Savvas.
We’ll have to kill everything to have access to the Lurker’s remains I think.
With all the enemies dead, you can actually take a moment to enjoy the beauty of these caves.
The ambience is kind of ruined by the Nightshroud hacking at that Lurker corpse over there though...
Lose if Nightshroud is exhausted
Are those Living Corpses… in a Vermling nest?
I take it that the stinking dead corpse they’re snacking on was the custodian. No glamour in this job, I tell you.
The quicker you clear out this nest and retrieve the key the better, I think.
Something tells me our custodian and his key are inside…
Demonsgate should be paying us Guard rates, seeing as we always seem to do their jobs!
With the last Vermling slain, you’re able to retrieve the Vault key from the half-eaten custodian. You try not to gag as you fish the key out from the corpse.
Living Bones? Great. Now it’s worse than snakes.
Whatever let the animals in likely brought the Living Bones. I’m sure we’ll find our clue in this room.
Isn’t this vault meant to be sealed?
There must be a breach somewhere. We’ll have to find it.
Well, hurry up and get rid of the snakes at least. This place gives me the creeps.
Now that you’ve driven out snake and skeleton alike, you finally take in your surroundings. Nothing is left in the Vault, save green puddles with a horrific smell.
Following the smell to its source, you find a barely human-sized hole in the room’s corner, soaked in green goo, which leads back up into the streets of Demonsgate.
It seems our trail has gone cold. I’ll take some of this… goo back to the Enchantress. Maybe she’ll know something about it.
Lose if Quartermaster is exhausted
Lurkers and Imps are battling with Living Bones and Corpses as you come through the door into the strange forest. They all turn their attention to you.
A Forest? Inside a cave decorated by Inox? This is getting too much.
Wherever we are, those Undead have Demonsgate weapons - with any luck, they’re guarding the stockpile.
All Undead get +1 Attack
Who knew Inox could ever decorate something like this?
There’s more to Inox than you think. In the meantime, this is exactly the kind of place I would hide stolen weapons...
The trees rustle in a mysterious breeze as the battle ends. You noticed a strange feeling, a strength, as you entered the undergrowth, and it only feels stronger now.
The Quartermaster has confirmed the Undead’s weapons to be from the stolen stockpile, but their arms account for barely a quarter.
I assume it would have been less than a quarter, but Living Bones do have those extra arms...
HOWEVER, he did come across a strange artifact. Come back, and we’ll take a look.
Lose if the Quartermaster is exhausted

The night is foggy and cold, and you have been waiting on that mossy stump for what seems to be hours. Your fingers and toes start to feel numb, but your ears do not: a twig cracks on your left, and out of the gloom come a small group of Bandits. This was...unexpected.
Sorry Luv, the boss has decided you know a bit too much of his grand plan, and well, we’ve been brought in to tie up a few loose ends.
Mind you, he’s paid us your wages, luckily our job is going to be nice and easy...
It seems your would-be assassins weren’t lying. They are carrying enough money to cover your original payment.
That is kind of irrelevant now: no one double crosses you. Firstly, it’s just plain rude, and secondly, it’s bad for business. And no one messes with your business.

Stepping into the second clearing, it does not take long to notice that these Vermlings are not led by the Inox you were looking for, but rather by Inox Shaman. One does have markings similar to those you have seen on previous lieutenants, though. Maybe you can get some information out of him after all.
A pack of Vermlings and Hounds are in the forest, but the Inox is nowhere to be seen. You'll have to fight through them to reach the next clearing.

As the Shaman falls to the floor, the remaining Vermlings flee out of the clearing. You rush to his side to question him but curse as you realise it is too late: he is already dead. Rummaging through his belongings, you find a simplistic map on a goat skin, with charcoal lines marking the location of a hideout. Your next destination.
As you open the final door, you expect to see your adversary. But apart from even more Inox, he is nowhere to be found!
All Enemies start Stunned
All Enemies are permanently Muddled
You charge into the campsit. The gathered Inox turn to fight, but they will take a while to react.

The Inox army is now all but scattered to the winds. You could easily walk away with their spoils and see justice in that, but you are a woman of principles. The coward has apparently sealed himself in the inner chambers with a supply of food. You’ll have to find another way in, and you’ll need some help!
Lose if the Beast Tyrant or Nightshroud is exhausted
The room opens up and an abomination sits in front of you, a giant stalk with a mouth of razor sharp teeth.
It seems we have finally found the source of the Rot.
Let’s take it out!
I’ve never smelt anything so unpleasant before, we must be close.
<thud>
Let’s push through these enemies into the room ahead!
As you hit the Sightless Eye for the last time, it shudders and then explodes, showering you all with a foul-smelling goo.
That… was unpleasant.
Lose if the Soothsinger Dies
All Heroes and Allies start Muddled
You all groggily get to your feet, the alcohol dulling your senses.
Strange silhouettes stumble out of the trees. You initially think they are drunk revellers, but the stench of the Undead comes on the wind.
To arms! Destroy as many Undead as you can!
The Undead hordes stop coming through the trees, and the forest is silent, apart from the heavy breaths taken by the survivors.
All Heroes and Allies start Strengthened
Undead again. What are the chances of this happening twice?
Let’s discuss this later. For now, we have some bones to break.
I’m detecting strong magic nearby. You’ll need to head to the other clearings and shut down whatever is causing the Undead to appear.
As the altars are destroyed, the remaining Undead fall to the ground. The Cultists run off into the undergrowth, defeated.
Demons & Undead, who are we up against?
As you step out into the clearing, a cultist seems surprised to see you.
You!.... But… He will not be amused! Kill her, now!
The Cultist points at the Soothsinger as he shouts.
Kill everything else, but we need that Cultist alive!
With the Undead & Demons dead, you discover a Cultist hiding under a table, it is time to interrogate him.
Kill all enemies apart from the Cultist
Spellweaver gets <nobr>+1 Attack <sprite name=Attack></nobr> on Ranged Attacks
Forest Imps get <nobr>+1 Attack <sprite name=Attack></nobr> on Ranged Attacks
At the start of each round the Ice Element is set to Strong
You aren’t going to be able to investigate the area with these Imps around. You’ll have to drive them away.
Also, it seems as if attacks, both yours and theirs, are more dangerous.
Now the clearing is peaceful, you are able to search around for clues. You find a number of strange scorch marks on the floor, and deduce that powerful demonic summonings have occurred here.
Behind one tree, you find a hastily dug grave. Inside is the body of Bandit, seemingly torn to shreds by talons.
And more Demons! Why do people think they can control Demons?
Characters attacking Cultists gain Disadvantage
So, these Bandits are working with a Cult. Why am I not surprised?
It seems someone at the top of this Cult has access to some very powerful summoning magic. The only way to restore balance is to take them down.
I feel, however, that currently they may just be too powerful for us to be victorious. We need help...
All Elements are set to Inert at the start of every round
You awake on the floor of a dusty chamber. Golems, Snakes, and Drakes look on. This is not good.
The voice speaks again… 'I know why you come, you seek power to defeat the Demon Summoner. This, I can grant you.’
‘But first, you must prove you have power within. Defeat the enemies without the Elements to guide you.’
Something has locked off access to all elements in this tomb. This will be a very dangerous fight!
As the last enemy falls, the voice booms out once more.
‘You have been judged worthy. When you are at your hour of need, I will grant your boon.’
I suppose Wind Demons explain that odd smell…
There must be a Demon Altar nearby. Destroy it, and we’ll likely find what the Summoner sensed on our way out.
There’s no altar… Focus on finding an exit. We’ll come back with a plan.
This altar-less rift must be that plane disturbance thingy. Make sure you escape with all my expensive gea- I mean your lives.
Watch your back: the Demons will follow you out.
You’d think we would have found every creepy Fire Demon-infested dungeon in Gloomhaven by now, right?
Especially ones with collapsing entrances. Find a new exit, and watch out for those traps. It looks like they were meant to keep something inside.
Crisp evening air prickles your skin as you stumble out of the trapdoor, panting for your lives.
The Summoner manages to spawn one last bolt of energy down the doorway before she seals it. Though exhausted, her face is full of disgust as she looks at you.
Lose if the Summoner or Harrower Elite is exhausted.
Our floating... "friend" seems to be drawn to this room. This should be the last push.
Hang on. Am I the only one who finds it strange that all of this city fits inside the rotting building we saw outside?
I learned not to ask questions in this profession a long time ago..
There’s no way I’m going near a Harrower. Why are you following one?!
I think the Summoner, er, summoned it. I’m sure she has a plan.
If that oversized bug is part of this “plan”, keep it safe. The other things in this library seem to want to kill it as much as they want to kill us.
With the room safe, the Harrower that led you here disintegrates into a cloud of insects. The Summoner gives you a stern look.
After a short while, it reforms holding a battered book. The Summoner takes the book, and engulfs the Harrower in energy from her staff. When the light fades, it’s gone.
Lose if the Summoner is exhausted.
It would appear the Summoner has led you straight into the dungeon chamber where the rift resides.
Maybe we were right not to sell that crusty old book...
The Summoner has started a spell of holding to close the rift. You’ll need to stay close by until it finishes - it will take time.
And maybe don’t die? There seem to be more Demons in here than last time!
The Summoner’s body ignites a bright, pale purple and bathes the room. When the glow dims, the Demons and the rift are no more.
However, in the rift’s place sits a steaming, bronze hemisphere. It hisses gently.
Lose if the Summoner is exhausted
Everyone still in one piece? Good. Let’s clear this den of animals and get out of here!
The last beast falls to the ground and you head straight out, not wanting to get trapped in here if the rocks shift again!
Here’s the headquarters of the camp, we should find the location of the whole operation if we take these Harrowers out.
All Enemies start Muddled
It seems that little guy has caught them unawares, quick get in while they are confused!
With the enemies dead, you release a small number of Vermlings who inform you that the majority have been taken north.
Pasted to the wall is a large map of the realm and a big red X is marked on it.
This leads underground, but I can sense a breeze coming through, perhaps a wall has collapsed further in.
The Vermlings are getting overrun!
We can’t help them now, we’ll have to regroup and help them later on.
I think I can see sunlight further on, keep going!
Ah, fresh air, let’s get out of here!
‘You really think I’d be stupid enough to leave an obvious clue like that in one of my secondary camps?’
‘Your confidence will be your undoing… Kill them all!’
I don’t know who that was, but the route we came in from is blocked.
Our best bet is to kill the Harrowers in charge and get out of here!
As you leave this place, the Sunkeeper waves something in her hand, apparently she grabbed something off a Harrower as it died.
Kill both Harrower Infesters
Lose if the Sunkeeper is exhausted
In this room is the remains of what seems to be an old summoning portal, and an old battered chest.
That chest might hold what you need?
Although this cave is now home to wild animals, you see scorch marks and damage that seems to be of a magical nature. Perhaps this is the right place.
Best to search out the cave, and see if there is anything to find.
As well as containing a small pile of ancient coins, the chest has a number of old scrolls. The Tinkerer takes these away for research.
The doorway leads into the ruined temple you expected to find, and here you see more Cultists. They have activated some ancient defence systems!
Keep going for the Cultists, and then the Golems will deactivate!
Cultists have permanent <nobr>+2 Shield <sprite name=Shield></nobr>
Cultists heal 1 Health at the end of each Round
Keep your voices down. The High Priest will NOT be amused if anyone finds this location, and you can guarantee I will not take the blame for your mistakes.
Suddenly, he turns to face your location.
Gah, too late. Kill them, quickly!
Clearly the Cultists are in charge here, I reckon if you kill them, the Bandits will soon disperse!
As the Last Cultist dies, the Golems deactivate immediately and any remaining Bandits head off into the undergrowth. Finally, you are able to look around the temple at your leisure.
There is a wealth of information here. These documents describe how to control the elements, and how to open portals to the demonic realms. It is all heresy.
It may be heresy, but we should research it! It will help us investigate what the Cultists are planning, and also how to stop them.
Heroes gain <nobr>+1 Attack <sprite name=Attack></nobr>
Heroes have permanent <nobr>+1 Shield <sprite name=Shield></nobr>
Something seems different about this Sun Demon: it is aggressive towards the Night Demons. Perhaps we can communicate with it?
It still seems to be aggressive towards us, so try and keep the Night Demons off it. Infusing Light should help it stay alive.
I should be able to close these portals in a short time, keep it alive until then.
The dark portals blink out of existence, and the Night Demons disappear along with them. With the threat gone, the Sun Demon becomes more passive.
You try to communicate with it, but it gestures its arms and creates a powerful beam of light. You duck for cover but are blinded by the flash.
Lose if the Elementalist or Soothsinger is exhausted
I have spent generations preparing for this moment, to gain my revenge on the one who trapped me here.
Time to kill the last descendant of that meddlesome bard, Melody.
Here we are, face to face at last...
The keep is freezing inside, but seemingly silent until a voice booms out…
‘You’ have released the lock? This is better than I had planned, I only wanted you dead, but now, now I will be free!
As the voice goes silent, undead and demons materialise and attack…
We need to push forwards, he must be in a later room!
With a scream, the remains of Swagger fall to dust on the ground, it seems the Soothsinger now has nothing to fear.
Closed to outsiders? Who do they think they are?
Well, I guess we know why the traders never came back...
They clearly aren’t going to let you go. Take them down, and then we can investigate further.
With the Militia dead, the townspeople begin to emerge from their homes.
The villagers have told me that this Militia came to Amberhill from Millpond. That town could be in even more trouble… we should head there next.
This room has more escapees, but you hear the sound of combat coming from behind the next door.
Maybe someone else is helping round up the criminals.
There is Rubble everywhere in here. Careful, it’ll slow you down.
More Demons! These ones are capable of creating the tremors in the area!
It looks as if you may be able to use the remaining escapees to help take them down.
We’re not going back in there, you’ll have to kill us first!
I guess you’ll have to do what the man says.
As the Earth Demons fall back to rubble, workers from the asylum come to take away the bodies of those that tried to escape.
In the corner of the chamber you find some more of the strange crystals.
The smell is worse in here, there are even more of them!
Well this stench can only mean one thing: Living Corpses! They are big and hit hard, but boy are they slow.
Oh, they also have a fondness for vomiting... Keep on your toes and hit them from range and you should be fine.
The last of the Undead falls to the floor, and the curse on this place is lifted.
You enter the next chamber and floating in front of you is a Savvas
The Savvas have put up with lesser races for too long.
You encroach on our land, use our resources, and defile our temples.
We say No More!
I can feel the power of the crystals emanating from nearby rooms. Your task is to destroy them. Try not to be distracted with this Savvas!
You awake on the floor of a chamber. Demons are advancing towards you.
You’ll need to press forwards, there is no way back here!
As the last Crystal is smashed to pieces, the Demons dissipate, and any remaining Savvas flee.
One step closer to destroying this Savvas sect!
Lurkers again? Why are they so interested in our water?
Whatever it is, they aren’t going to get it for free!
You’d try and sell anything, I mean, water IS free!
Stick it in a flask, put a name on it, and idiots will buy anything!
Would you look at all of that Rot?
Why would I, when I can smell it?
You know the drill. If we clear the area of enemies, the Rot should stop polluting the water.
And then we’ll never come back?
And then we’ll work out where the creatures came from. And then we’ll never come back.
Look at all of those horrible Oozes… I can’t wait until we get rid of this blasted Rot!
At least they’re not stone golems, right?
Stop. Don’t even say those words.
As the last Ooze dribbles into a puddle, the Rot around the cave crumbles away and the water clears.
But the rotten stench stays, and streaks of black are still visible in the water...
It appears this wasn’t the source. We’ll have to travel further south, and hopefully we’ll learn of the Lurkers’ plans on the way.
As you pass through a clearing, hounds burst out of the undergrowth followed by high pitched laughing. It seems the villagers were right!
Imps! We never believed the elders of my clan when they said they used to deal with fairies.
The world must be in dire straights if they have become this brazen. Beware their magic, an Imp’s curse is not to be taken lightly!
Also, some scenarios have branching paths. In this case it seems there are two routes. Ensure you always investigate all doors - you may need to split the party.
With the Imps and Hounds dead, the colours of the forest return to normal, and you head on towards the village.
I’ve been hearing rumours of Night Demons prowling areas to the north, but this is the first time I’ve seen them in the flesh.
They use the power of the Dark, Light will help you defeat them!
Or cold, hard steel... but beware, they give all attackers disadvantage on their attacks!
I hate those things, they're like overgrown spiders... why do they have so many arms?
More arms mean more claws, and more claws means more killing.
That was a rhetorical question, but thanks, I’ll sleep soundly tonight...
Ah, what these friendly Inox didn’t inform us was that the Demons have bent the local Forest Imps to their cause. This will be an unpleasant fight.
With the Demons dead, the Imps in the area flee and the Inox begin returning to their homes.
I’d hope that’s the last we’ll see of the Sun Demons, but I know that won’t be the case.
Here are where the last of the Cultists reside. Kill them, and the creatures should dissipate.
The cavern is guarded by Demons and Spirits, but you must venture forth to help the inhabitants of Eastgrove.
As the final Cultist dies, their hold over the Demons and Spirits are broken, and the Crypt falls silent.
This deeper part of the cave is certainly hotter than the others, with molten areas of rock on the walls.
Careful, it looks like some of the floor is super-heated and dangerous..
Avoid it yourself, but it can be used like traps to injure or kill any non-flying enemies!
Demons! What are these ones though? They seem entirely created from fire!
I have read of these. Flame Demons. They have not been seen in these parts before... what has brought them here?
The initial cavern you enter feels similar to many you have seen before, although the colours feel a little strange.
As you investigate, you disturb a number of creatures that live here. You’ll need to dispatch them and head into a deeper part of the hillside.
With the Demons dead, the lava begins to cool. You also find some of those mysterious crystals scattered around the cavern.
Someone or something is using these crystals to sow chaos across the land... but why?
You enter the tomb and see hooded figures performing rites… Cultists! No, they carry swords and shields, Bandits…
These Bandits have access to powerful magic, I can see they have opened portals through which necromantic energies are flowing.
Ignore the undead if you can, you must kill all the Bandits to stop the rite!
With the magic users dead, the portals close and the undead turn to dust.
Their power is extinguished, and their hold on this town broken!
Whew, I can’t believe something that ugly actually has friends.
We can’t let any escape, you’ll have to take them all out!
That Harrower seemed to be in command of these soldiers…
Wow. Imagine being bossed around by a cloud of bugs!
But it also seems to be alone here. If you can kill this one too, we may learn more about what it's doing here.
You’d also likely break up this merry little gathering!
As the last cloak falls to the ground, the soldiers around you begin to pull back.
Harrowers commanding Milita? We may be in grave danger...
There’s always some grave danger in this damn place! Where’s the fluffy danger? The harmless, fluffy danger?
Well, I guess Drakes and Hounds explain a smell that bad. But I was banking on the Harrowers… or my ex.
Choose your moves carefully, these are tough enemies!
They intercepted us before we reached Ironbell. We can’t let them reach those forges.
You know, for a bunch of bugs under a cloak, Harrowers move pretty damn fast.
However fast they are, they don’t look like they came prepared for a proper fight. You should be able to push them back from the city.
As the last soldier falls, silence returns to the walls of Ironbell.
Ironbell is saved, and has pledged to arm our mercenaries. We just need a way to get them into Keyport now.
I can’t wait to go and tell this Council how bad their name is.
It sounds as if the forest itself is alive, the cracks of branches and snaps of twigs coming from all around you. You are surrounded!
